commit_message:
Upgrade/update instructions for 5.1; relnotes descriptions

This commit covers all the docs about upgrade and update
as well as refinements to the what-is, new-features, and
other-enhancements sections.

Includes change to use lrzuntar to unpack the 5.1 tarball
with a warning that the Fuel Master node requires 2GB RAM for
this to work, with a link to the hardware requirements for
the master

Includes corrections to the Release Notes Upgrade and Update sections
and to this information in the User Guide.

user-guide/cli.rst -- info from https://review.openstack.org/120428
about the update option.

Ref-Arch now includes 8000-fuel-upgrade that describes how
upgrade works

Release Notes are restructured to include:
- "Known Issues fixed in 5.1 and 5.0.2" is added in 117672
- "HA issues fixed in 5.1" is added in 117338

Change-Id: Ie2054b31ce216942fd64b5bf274d8efa7d300bc4
Closes-Bug: 1360372
Closes-Bug: 1367199

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-23 07:07:41.000000000', 'files': ['_images/Neutron_nsx_l3.png', '_images/Neutron_nsx_topology.png', '_images/Neutron_nsx_l2.png', 'pages/release-notes/v5-1/050-known-issues.rst', '_images/assign-public-ips-to-computes.png', 'pages/reference-architecture/neutron-intro/0270-nsx.rst'], 'message': 'augment "Neutron with NSX topology" section

- we recommend to dispose NSX nodes in OpenStack Management network if

  illustrates aformentioned topology
- otherwise NSX network must have L3 connectivity with OpenStack Public
  network; in this case Compute nodes must receive Public addresses
  (checkbox on Settings tab must be ticked)
- mention this in Known Issues for 5.1 release
- add figure for topology with L3 connectivity
- while here fix typo on figures ("Constrollers")

Closes-bug: #1367859

commit_message:
augment "Neutron with NSX topology" section

- we recommend to dispose NSX nodes in OpenStack Management network if
  possible
- rename Neutron_nsx_topology.png to _images/Neutron_nsx_l2.png that
  illustrates aformentioned topology
- otherwise NSX network must have L3 connectivity with OpenStack Public
  network; in this case Compute nodes must receive Public addresses
  (checkbox on Settings tab must be ticked)
- mention this in Known Issues for 5.1 release
- add figure for topology with L3 connectivity
- while here fix typo on figures ("Constrollers")

Change-Id: I6f7948a9bfa2b5c6e7cf6e8a3636d94f913a71d1
Closes-bug: #1367859

commit_message:
Information about VMware vCenter and NSX features is updated.

Following documents are updated:
- Terminology: links in the 'nsx' term added
- Planning guide:
-- Choose Network Topology: information about nsx added
-- Nodes and Roles: notes added
-- Preparing vSphere Integration: notes and limitations added
- Reference Architecture: notes added, HA setup diagram updated
- User Guide: screenshots updated, vcenter-deploy.rst updated,
  7310-nsx-deploy.rst, add screenshot with filled NSX settings

I added a link to the vCenter page for assigning roles.  The
screen shot was too small to really see the verbage about not
assigning a Controller node so I increased the size of that image
and others in the vicinity.

Implements: blueprint vcenter-documentation-update-fuel-5.1
Change-Id: Ibcb5c1b7cd2a286e2239d17d87ea49eb10930964

subject: state the fact that NSX Service node is mandatory for Mirantis OpenStack
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-23 07:07:41.000000000', 'files': ['pages/planning-guide/7000-nsx-plan.rst'], 'message': "state the fact that NSX Service node is mandatory for Mirantis OpenStack

- NSX cluster can successfully operate without Service node, but our
  tests show that creation of virtual interfaces fails, due to incorrect
  configuration of `replication_mode' setting in Neutron NSX plugin
  confguration file (plugin is configured to use Service node)
- we need more work to be done to implement working Mirantis OpenStack
  with NSX cluster that operates without Service node
- note that OpenStack itself can be used with NSX cluster that lacks
  Service node
- while here add missing article

Change-Id: Ibd88834a525104f4c9e71c355c3e7e0ea833adba
Closes-bug: #1365043
"}]
commit_message:
state the fact that NSX Service node is mandatory for Mirantis OpenStack

- NSX cluster can successfully operate without Service node, but our
  tests show that creation of virtual interfaces fails, due to incorrect
  configuration of `replication_mode' setting in Neutron NSX plugin
  confguration file (plugin is configured to use Service node)
- we need more work to be done to implement working Mirantis OpenStack
  with NSX cluster that operates without Service node
- note that OpenStack itself can be used with NSX cluster that lacks
  Service node
- while here add missing article

Change-Id: Ibd88834a525104f4c9e71c355c3e7e0ea833adba
Closes-bug: #1365043

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 330, 'name': 'John Dickinson', 'email': 'me@not.mn', 'username': 'notmyname'}, {'_account_id': 597, 'name': 'Pete Zaitcev', 'email': 'zaitcev@kotori.zaitcev.us', 'username': 'zaitcev'}, {'_account_id': 866, 'name': 'Chmouel Boudjnah', 'email': 'chmouel@chmouel.com', 'username': 'chmouel'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 6198, 'name': 'Peter Portante', 'email': 'peter.a.portante@gmail.com', 'username': 'peter-a-portante'}, {'_account_id': 6968, 'name': 'Christian Schwede', 'email': 'cschwede@redhat.com', 'username': 'cschwede'}, {'_account_id': 7233, 'name': 'Matthew Oliver', 'email': 'matt@oliver.net.au', 'username': 'mattoliverau'}, {'_account_id': 7479, 'name': 'paul luse', 'email': 'paul.e.luse@intel.com', 'username': 'peluse'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 8542, 'name': 'Prashanth Pai', 'email': 'ppai@redhat.com', 'username': 'pai'}, {'_account_id': 9625, 'name': 'Thiago da Silva', 'email': 'thiagodasilva@gmail.com', 'username': 'thiago'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-08-21 15:34:24.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/constraints.py', 'setup.cfg', 'swift/common/middleware/mem_constraints.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py'], 'message': 'Storage Policy defined constraints middleware

Adding a constraints middleware that allows different
constraints rules per storage policy.

Currently, Swift allows only one set of object naming
and metadata rules per cluster. As new storage policies
are implemented, it is possible that different storage
back-ends have different set of rules on how objects
should be created for that specific storage system.

This patch attempts to refactor some of the default
object validation in PUT requests, so that the validation
happens early enough to quickly respond with errors, but
also adds the ability to new middlewares to define
their own constraints for a specific storage policy.

A mem_constraints middleware was added to serve as an
example where objects stored on an object mem_server
would have more strict naming rules (e.g., name length
max is 128).

A real-world example of where this constraints middleware
is necessary can be found on the SwiftOnFile project.
SwiftOnFile has different rules as objects name are mapped
to a POSIX filesystem directory structure.
Example: no names with double slashes or ending with
slashes are allowed.
SwiftOnFile constraints middleware: http://goo.gl/a96Icc

Change-Id: I46361969979c7ed9477f34cba9f74c13e89617d9
Signed-off-by: Thiago da Silva <thiago@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Storage Policy defined constraints middleware

Adding a constraints middleware that allows different
constraints rules per storage policy.

Currently, Swift allows only one set of object naming
and metadata rules per cluster. As new storage policies
are implemented, it is possible that different storage
back-ends have different set of rules on how objects
should be created for that specific storage system.

This patch attempts to refactor some of the default
object validation in PUT requests, so that the validation
happens early enough to quickly respond with errors, but
also adds the ability to new middlewares to define
their own constraints for a specific storage policy.

A mem_constraints middleware was added to serve as an
example where objects stored on an object mem_server
would have more strict naming rules (e.g., name length
max is 128).

A real-world example of where this constraints middleware
is necessary can be found on the SwiftOnFile project.
SwiftOnFile has different rules as objects name are mapped
to a POSIX filesystem directory structure.
Example: no names with double slashes or ending with
slashes are allowed.
SwiftOnFile constraints middleware: http://goo.gl/a96Icc

Change-Id: I46361969979c7ed9477f34cba9f74c13e89617d9
Signed-off-by: Thiago da Silva <thiago@redhat.com>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7233, 'name': 'Matthew Oliver', 'email': 'matt@oliver.net.au', 'username': 'mattoliverau'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 9205, 'name': 'Gil Vernik', 'email': 'gilv@il.ibm.com', 'username': 'gilv'}, {'_account_id': 9625, 'name': 'Thiago da Silva', 'email': 'thiagodasilva@gmail.com', 'username': 'thiago'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-09-17 18:00:15.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/data_migration_common.py', 'swift/common/middleware/data_migration.py', 'swift/common/data_migrator_drivers.py'], 'message': 'Moving data migration handling to base driver class

Experimenting with a new idea to move the handling
of the data migration to the base driver class.

This change introduces a new method migrate_object
and moves upload_object to DataMigrationDriver.

These changes allow for new drivers to override
upload_object and completely change the way data
is read from source and written to destination.
This new driver was created to test some new ideas
with the design of the migration middleware.

data_migration.py is now responsible for loading the
correct driver and calling its migrate_object method.

Change-Id: Ib7279d772f737f5b7e6832097e6d3c7393bdcf06
Signed-off-by: Thiago da Silva <thiago@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Moving data migration handling to base driver class

Experimenting with a new idea to move the handling
of the data migration to the base driver class.

This change introduces a new method migrate_object
and moves upload_object to DataMigrationDriver.

These changes allow for new drivers to override
upload_object and completely change the way data
is read from source and written to destination.
This new driver was created to test some new ideas
with the design of the migration middleware.

data_migration.py is now responsible for loading the
correct driver and calling its migrate_object method.

Change-Id: Ib7279d772f737f5b7e6832097e6d3c7393bdcf06
Signed-off-by: Thiago da Silva <thiago@redhat.com>

subject: Safer use of eval
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-22 19:47:21.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/test_utils.py', 'ceilometer/transformer/arithmetic.py', 'ceilometer/transformer/conversions.py', 'ceilometer/utils.py'], 'message': "Safer use of eval

eval() was used with an empty globals parameter. This meant that
the expression could call __import__ and then do whatever (remove
all your files, for examples). By setting globals to
{'__builtins__': None} the expression can't use __import__.

This is for security hardening.

SecurityImpact

Change-Id: I91a32a62204dd44fa850f9ec0efd4f45cd3d72c2
Partial-Bug: #1367022
"}]
commit_message:
Safer use of eval

eval() was used with an empty globals parameter. This meant that
the expression could call __import__ and then do whatever (remove
all your files, for examples). By setting globals to
{'__builtins__': None} the expression can't use __import__.

This is for security hardening.

SecurityImpact

Change-Id: I91a32a62204dd44fa850f9ec0efd4f45cd3d72c2
Partial-Bug: #1367022

subject: Add a server with volumes ResourceGroup example
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-12 10:59:59.000000000', 'files': ['hot/resource_group/volume_with_attachment.yaml', 'hot/resource_group/server_with_volumes.yaml', 'hot/resource_group/resource_group.yaml'], 'message': 'Add a server with volumes ResourceGroup example

Adds an example in response to a ML question, shows how you can
create a resource group containing a number of nested stacks containing
identical volumes and volume attachment resources, then pass in the
server ID to have the volumes attached to one server.

Also moves the current basic example into a resource_group subdirectory,
so we can collect related examples, and make more obvious that the
volume_with_attachment template is part of another example rather than
a standalone example template.

Change-Id: I1ffc1656286a981b6dc219038e03adbb8d5af775
'}]
commit_message:
Add a server with volumes ResourceGroup example

Adds an example in response to a ML question, shows how you can
create a resource group containing a number of nested stacks containing
identical volumes and volume attachment resources, then pass in the
server ID to have the volumes attached to one server.

Also moves the current basic example into a resource_group subdirectory,
so we can collect related examples, and make more obvious that the
volume_with_attachment template is part of another example rather than
a standalone example template.

Change-Id: I1ffc1656286a981b6dc219038e03adbb8d5af775

commit_message:
require a minimum of websockify 0.6

Websockify 0.6 fixes a substantial number of zombie process issues
seen in Nova. It was released in Feb 2014, and all our current tests
in the gate have been with websockify 0.6. So this mostly brings g-r
in line with reality.

Change-Id: Ieb8945dbe4c3c4c3170ea5a53ca6370814c5e945
Closes-Bug: #1048703

commit_message:
VMware: do not cache image when root_gb is 0

Save space on datastore when the instance size has root_gb of
0. There is no need to cache the disk as it already exists on
the datastore.

TrivialFix

Closes-bug: #1304593
(cherry picked from commit 9b14ae62a6396a2599c8a2ada1a50e3f69a2eddc)

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_driver_api.py
	nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py

Change-Id: Iac75d97f40a1a91b8fa2df7fb4318fc2965fd93a

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 11279, 'name': 'Angus Lees', 'email': 'gus@inodes.org', 'username': 'gus'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-11 18:24:40.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Bump sqlalchemy-migrate to 0.9.2

The new version executes multi-statement SQL scripts statement by
statement. This is needed to pass some migration rules when using a
SQLAlchemy driver that does not support multiple statements passed to
.execute() as a single string (f.e. MySQL Connector).

One of the projects that rely on those multi-statement SQL scripts when
doing migrations is Glance.

blueprint enable-mysql-connector

Change-Id: I2b6779ace131d2a2431b5ab8c8fce8ab71dc2638
'}]
commit_message:
Bump sqlalchemy-migrate to 0.9.2

The new version executes multi-statement SQL scripts statement by
statement. This is needed to pass some migration rules when using a
SQLAlchemy driver that does not support multiple statements passed to
.execute() as a single string (f.e. MySQL Connector).

One of the projects that rely on those multi-statement SQL scripts when
doing migrations is Glance.

blueprint enable-mysql-connector

Change-Id: I2b6779ace131d2a2431b5ab8c8fce8ab71dc2638

commit_message:
Change order for yum-repos file in centos7 element

Due to changes in centos7 element to use package-installs the order
of yum-repos in pre-install.d needs to be changed, to make yum repos
available before package-installs is called to install packages.

Change-Id: I47b584506465d90247f30bad515a32323e52180e

commit_message:
Fix for missing notification in Sahara OSTF

Platform test for Sahara fails without any messages
if default security group doesn't have needed "TCP" rules.
Now needed "TCP" rules when running the test are created.

Closes-Bug: #1342639

Change-Id: I2e325252e12528b4f31241d903c6a4ef4e2965b3

commit_message:
Support custom nameservers in setup-neutron

Allow the network description to pass in the nameserver to be used
for the subnet, falling back to the default of 8.8.8.8 for floating
networks if one is not specified.

Change-Id: Ibd8a33b0f1a3e26fb14b5050dd7e536828a3f3eb

commit_message:
Set socket options in correct way

Currently socket options, socket.SO_REUSEADDR and socket.SO_KEEPALIVE
are set only if SSL is enabled.
The above socket options should be set no matter SSL is enabled or not.

Closes-Bug: #1369418

Change-Id: Ia5f6603918bda40be9965387bf464c581449d912

subject: labs: dnsmasq config: /etc/hosts, DNS server, logging
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-22 14:11:47.000000000', 'files': ['labs/config/openstack', 'labs/scripts/setup_neutron_network.sh'], 'message': "labs: dnsmasq config: /etc/hosts, DNS server, logging

Configure dnsmasq to use the Google Public DNS and the node VM's
/etc/hosts for resolving hostnames (lets instance VM resolve the names
of node VMs, e.g. ping controller-api).

This configuration is in effect as long as the instance VMs use dnsmasq
for DNS name resolution (they do not if the neutron subnet has
dns_nameservers configured).

Since we turn on verbose logging in neutron scripts on the network node
VM, enable logging for dnsmasq, too.

Change-Id: I4bf470ddd87034fc0dcf29b612860ccda057f5e0
"}]
commit_message:
labs: dnsmasq config: /etc/hosts, DNS server, logging

Configure dnsmasq to use the Google Public DNS and the node VM's
/etc/hosts for resolving hostnames (lets instance VM resolve the names
of node VMs, e.g. ping controller-api).

This configuration is in effect as long as the instance VMs use dnsmasq
for DNS name resolution (they do not if the neutron subnet has
dns_nameservers configured).

Since we turn on verbose logging in neutron scripts on the network node
VM, enable logging for dnsmasq, too.

Change-Id: I4bf470ddd87034fc0dcf29b612860ccda057f5e0

subject: Mark openstack-doc-tools as being a universal wheel
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-22 09:09:21.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Mark openstack-doc-tools as being a universal wheel

Universal is used to identify pure-Python module(by bdist_wheel).
For these, it is sufficient to build a wheel with _any_ Python ABI
version and publish that to PyPI (by whatever means).

Change-Id: I83c09e2d2658280fd799675e9ef290841b2cd087
'}]
commit_message:
Mark openstack-doc-tools as being a universal wheel

Universal is used to identify pure-Python module(by bdist_wheel).
For these, it is sufficient to build a wheel with _any_ Python ABI
version and publish that to PyPI (by whatever means).

Change-Id: I83c09e2d2658280fd799675e9ef290841b2cd087

subject: labs: unregister clone VM disk, snapshots
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-22 14:53:17.000000000', 'files': ['labs/lib/osbash/virtualbox.functions'], 'message': 'labs: unregister clone VM disk, snapshots

Exporting via cloned VMs leaves the exported disks and snapshots
registered with VirtualBox (whether or not we pass a "--register" flag
to clonevm). Moving the exported VMs away or trying to export again to
the same location makes VirtualBox complain.

If we register the cloned VM upon creation and then unregister it
afterwards, we get at least rid of the snapshots and have only the
base disk left to unregister manually. This rather complicated method
is implemented here.

The export VMs have "-e" attached to their names, making them easier to
unregister here. They are also easy to recognize when imported into a
VirtualBox that already has node VMs using the original names.

Change-Id: I4532fd3152e705c3b35265359d7e6b0d5facd55e
'}]
commit_message:
labs: unregister clone VM disk, snapshots

Exporting via cloned VMs leaves the exported disks and snapshots
registered with VirtualBox (whether or not we pass a "--register" flag
to clonevm). Moving the exported VMs away or trying to export again to
the same location makes VirtualBox complain.

If we register the cloned VM upon creation and then unregister it
afterwards, we get at least rid of the snapshots and have only the
base disk left to unregister manually. This rather complicated method
is implemented here.

The export VMs have "-e" attached to their names, making them easier to
unregister here. They are also easy to recognize when imported into a
VirtualBox that already has node VMs using the original names.

Change-Id: I4532fd3152e705c3b35265359d7e6b0d5facd55e

commit_message:
Add -s option for neutron metering rules

While adding iptables rule, cidr is added as destination for both ingress
and egress directions. Modified code to add -s for egress and -d for ingress.

Closes-bug: 1310589

commit_message:
nova net-delete of associated network is not informative enough

Intially nova net-delete <Network ID> was raising an
"InternalServerError" in case the requested network to delete was associated to
any project.This error category “InternalServerError” is appropriate but the
error message description is not informative enough.

Now, when the command is not able to delete the requested network because
it is associated with a project, a message stating “network must be
disassociated from project <project-id> before delete” will be raised.
Updated the code to raise the new error message.

Closes-Bug: #1301373
Change-Id: I73cd6b1825061e5415983ca7caa8b9a0bcea8225

nova net-delete network is not informative enough

Intially nova net-delete <Network ID> was raising an
"InternalServerError" in case the requested network to
delete was associated to any project.This error category
“InternalServerError” is appropriate but the error
message description is not informative enough.

Now, when the command is not able to delete the requested
network because it is associated with a project, a message
stating “network must be disassociated from project
<project-id> before delete” will be raised. Updated the
code to raise the new error message.

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-08-14 10:35:34.000000000', 'files': ['os_cloud_config/cmd/register_nodes.py', 'os_cloud_config/nodes.py', 'os_cloud_config/tests/test_nodes.py'], 'message': "Allow capabilities to be set on ironic nodes

Since Ide39f4a2796b169025bf0083e021166ae35f30f8, Ironic has been able to
pass nodes' capabilities to the nova scheduler to allow for more
flexible and precise scheduling of instances.  This patch allows devtest
to pass capabilities from nodes.json (if they are present) to the
'ironic node-update' command which is already used to set nodes'
cpu_arch, memory and disk. The capabilities have to be passed in a
separate file of flavor definitions, and the nodes themelves actually
refer to flavors.

register-nodes moved repo.

commit_message:
Allow capabilities to be set on ironic nodes

Since Ide39f4a2796b169025bf0083e021166ae35f30f8, Ironic has been able to
pass nodes' capabilities to the nova scheduler to allow for more
flexible and precise scheduling of instances.  This patch allows devtest
to pass capabilities from nodes.json (if they are present) to the
'ironic node-update' command which is already used to set nodes'
cpu_arch, memory and disk. The capabilities have to be passed in a
separate file of flavor definitions, and the nodes themelves actually
refer to flavors.

This is a rewrite of I533336d193ee7bc46a7be79ff689f447aaf5770a after
register-nodes moved repo.

Part of bp targeted-node-deployment

Change-Id: I7c85cea3f680acdd1c9e8491d6ac707fc227b0b8

* Added WorkflowListSpec that represents a top level specification
  for uploading workflows (shouldn't be confused with WorkflowSpecList)
* Added workflow service that takes care of parsing, validating and
  creating multiple workflows from definition
* Added unit tests for workflow service
* Fixed workflow controller to work with multiple workflows on post/put
* Fixed workflow controller tests

Change-Id: I70a46a16e1970673fec0352091e4b610f320fbb8

commit_message:
Making workflow endpoint able to upload multiple workflows

* Added WorkflowListSpec that represents a top level specification
  for uploading workflows (shouldn't be confused with WorkflowSpecList)
* Added workflow service that takes care of parsing, validating and
  creating multiple workflows from definition
* Added unit tests for workflow service
* Fixed workflow controller to work with multiple workflows on post/put
* Fixed workflow controller tests

Change-Id: I70a46a16e1970673fec0352091e4b610f320fbb8

commit_message:
Allow user-defined flavors on the undercloud

Currently a single flavor called "baremetal" is created on the
undercloud.  This patch allows a user to specify flavors in more detail
by providing a json file containing flavor descriptions.

Part of bp targeted-node-deployment

Change-Id: Ia4e695a3137c84d7270769a2fdb617f9e8f0c964

commit_message:
For Glance add port 9191 to the iptables list

Recent changes to enable security through iptables now
requires this.  Port 9292 was already being correctly configured.

Reference https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1356040

Change-Id: I5f2214cd70b3ccc3d8aabce48927b9f5dda5d75b
Closes-Bug: 1356040

commit_message:
Use auth_token from keystonemiddleware

This changes swift proxy-server conf to use the
keystone authtoken middleware from the
keystonemiddleware project. auth_token in
keystoneclient has been deprecated.

The corresponding change was made to swift in this patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/109047/

Change-Id: I58dad8e1151067bf8df37e511fff5fc0e3dfb487

commit_message:
added clean_users flag in metadata

For securing rabbitmq setup, its important to delete users like guest.

This flags allows you to do the cleanup of all the remaining users that
are not specified through the metadata.

commit_message:
Add task file validate command

* Remove the redundant users context setup from benchmark.engine
* Add task_validate to orchestrator api
* Add verify command to validate the task file:
    rally task validate --deploy-id <deployment> --task <TASK FILE PATH>

Change-Id: I6cccf55cb390ae8bb95716db779a0c6daf965f99

commit_message:
Revert "Use dib-run-parts from dib-utils"

This isn't handling the common-venv/environment.d files the same as the
original dib-run-parts, as a result CI is running a lot slower (no
common venv) and lots of tests are timing out. Switch back to the old
method while we rectify the problem.

This reverts commit 644598941c912257cba3aa4221ebfe4953b7c66a.

commit_message:
Do not iterate action.choices if it is none

Do not iterate action.choices in the method add_arguments
in the class OpenStackHelpFormatter if action.choices is
not iterable because it is none.

Change-Id: Ie7110adb798326e5856fddfb6a7365c663b84998
Closes-Bug: #1372152

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-09-22 22:53:52.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/fakeldap.py', 'keystone/common/ldap/core.py', 'keystone/assignment/backends/ldap.py'], 'message': "Fix create and user-role-add in LDAP backend

The LDAP backend while generating 'dn' for ldapadd operations
does not add the id attribute in the attributes list
While newer versions of LDAP server support this operatoin,
older ones reported error. Eg. OpenLDAP 2.3

This change set fixes that error by adding the required
attribute in the list to make it compatible with older
LDAP versions

Change-Id: I1ed3f53d325eb280e036fbbf8e83d2e645db53cd
Closes-Bug: #1340041
"}]
commit_message:
Fix create and user-role-add in LDAP backend

The LDAP backend while generating 'dn' for ldapadd operations
does not add the id attribute in the attributes list
While newer versions of LDAP server support this operatoin,
older ones reported error. Eg. OpenLDAP 2.3

This change set fixes that error by adding the required
attribute in the list to make it compatible with older
LDAP versions

Change-Id: I1ed3f53d325eb280e036fbbf8e83d2e645db53cd
Closes-Bug: #1340041

commit_message:
Switch to static content for glance upload test

glance is able to fetch an image from a given url.
Previously the dashboard main page was used as image,
this change sets it a static image, in order
the have less gate issue.

Any url could be used which does not requires authentication.

Change-Id: I66760790aa7d2d0d7b8c53d62baf59134b9b44d6

subject: Added fix for dependacy for mysql-chef_gem
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-22 22:15:29.000000000', 'files': ['Berksfile.lock'], 'message': "Added fix for dependacy for mysql-chef_gem

Bumped the version to 0.0.4 that has a fix for ubuntu ruby191-dev.
The error this resolves is this:
```ruby
        /usr/bin/ruby1.9.1 extconf.rb
/usr/lib/ruby/1.9.1/rubygems/custom_require.rb:36:in `require': cannot load such file -- mkmf (LoadError)
        from /usr/lib/ruby/1.9.1/rubygems/custom_require.rb:36:in `require'
        from extconf.rb:5:in `<main>'
```

Change-Id: Ie86c3ab5f957b2b345df0ed2f1d0d6b610ba2178
"}]
commit_message:
Added fix for dependacy for mysql-chef_gem

Bumped the version to 0.0.4 that has a fix for ubuntu ruby191-dev.
The error this resolves is this:
```ruby
        /usr/bin/ruby1.9.1 extconf.rb
/usr/lib/ruby/1.9.1/rubygems/custom_require.rb:36:in `require': cannot load such file -- mkmf (LoadError)
        from /usr/lib/ruby/1.9.1/rubygems/custom_require.rb:36:in `require'
        from extconf.rb:5:in `<main>'
```

Change-Id: Ie86c3ab5f957b2b345df0ed2f1d0d6b610ba2178

commit_message:
make flavors use common limit and marker

Flavors REST calls were not using the common limit and 
marker function, which means that the osapi_max_limit configuration
that was set by the operator would not be respected. 

Convert flavors to use the common infrastructure thereby providing
a more consistent experience for users and operators.

Change-Id: Iabbf74cf14ddab9a67092ba966270a658ce6be3f
Closes-Bug: #1304790

subject: Delete backup created during replication
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2014-09-16 13:34:49.000000000', 'files': ['trove/taskmanager/manager.py', 'trove/taskmanager/models.py', 'trove/tests/api/replication.py'], 'message': 'Delete backup created during replication

During replication, backup of the master instance is
taken, and a slave is created using this backup.
This patch cleans up the backup which is created
during this process (irrespective of whether it was
successfully provisioned or not).

Closes-Bug: #1359354
Change-Id: Ic636ffeb0bbfb9e6cc02690efe812ffc11bda85c
'}]
commit_message:
Delete backup created during replication

During replication, backup of the master instance is
taken, and a slave is created using this backup.
This patch cleans up the backup which is created
during this process (irrespective of whether it was
successfully provisioned or not).

Closes-Bug: #1359354
Change-Id: Ic636ffeb0bbfb9e6cc02690efe812ffc11bda85c

commit_message:
Allow unsharing a network used as gateway/floatingip

If network has ports that connect it as gateway to another network, such
as an external network, or "floating ip" ports it should still be
possible to "unshare" it since these ports represent usage of the
network as an external network, not as a VM data network.

Change-Id: Ic33ae7ac193e4fc9fe06a4cfd579a4aacf0e6354
Closes-bug: #1293184
(cherry picked from commit 7a2053c7a27bdec02e97b46736c5fcce5f2d053a)

commit_message:
Early checks for data migration config and headers

Modify data_migration middleware and migration drivers so
that config is checked during middleware initialisation
and container migration headers are checked during container
PUT/POST requests.

Also add unit tests to increase coverage.

Change-Id: Iba532a38b21026559fab55dae1aa06a824c2b854

commit_message:
horizon ignores region for identity service

this change will attempt to use a identity service in the selected region
when available.  before the region for the identity service was always the first
found

commit_message:
[WIP] add scenario to test Cinder guarantees

* Cinder guarantees that a delete operation on a
  volume will not succeed until that volume is in
  the available state
* added a create_and_delete_volume_nowait scenario
  which attempts to delete the volume without
  waiting for the create to return that the volume
  is in the available state

Change-Id: Ie802aa750cdc75ba610a2e4f207f115fd13176a0

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2014-09-18 13:47:00.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/services/vpn/device_drivers/test_cisco_csr_rest.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/vpn/device_drivers/cisco_csr_mock.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/vpn/device_drivers/notest_cisco_csr_rest.py'], 'message': 'Rework and enable VPNaaS UT for Cisco CSR REST

The Cisco CSR REST client library unit tests were developed in
Icehouse, using the httmock library. However, the community did
not want to add this library to global requirements, as there was
a similar httpretty library available (albeit with some short-
comings). As a result, the test module was renamed with a "no"
prefix, to prevent inclusion in automated tests.

Since then, a new library, requests-mock, has been added to global
requirements, to replace httpretty, and is being used on several
other projects.

This commit reworks the unit test to use requests-mock, instead of
httmock. The functionality is the same, but the mechanism (a
fixture with URI registration vs context manager) is different.

This commit provides coverage for the REST client code, by using a
mock for the Cisco CSR VM. The unit test module can be subclassed,
and used with a real CSR VM, for 3rd party CI testing, in the
future.

Change-Id: I55c8a253eb32985bc2016ae748b1ded58d021e1a
Closes-Bug: 1358470
'}]
commit_message:
Rework and enable VPNaaS UT for Cisco CSR REST

The Cisco CSR REST client library unit tests were developed in
Icehouse, using the httmock library. However, the community did
not want to add this library to global requirements, as there was
a similar httpretty library available (albeit with some short-
comings). As a result, the test module was renamed with a "no"
prefix, to prevent inclusion in automated tests.

Since then, a new library, requests-mock, has been added to global
requirements, to replace httpretty, and is being used on several
other projects.

This commit reworks the unit test to use requests-mock, instead of
httmock. The functionality is the same, but the mechanism (a
fixture with URI registration vs context manager) is different.

This commit provides coverage for the REST client code, by using a
mock for the Cisco CSR VM. The unit test module can be subclassed,
and used with a real CSR VM, for 3rd party CI testing, in the
future.

Change-Id: I55c8a253eb32985bc2016ae748b1ded58d021e1a
Closes-Bug: 1358470

It's apparent that Nova is quite a ways from Py3K support, and
developers are not expected to run the py33 tox env. Rather than add

commit_message:
Remove unused py33 tox env

It's apparent that Nova is quite a ways from Py3K support, and
developers are not expected to run the py33 tox env. Rather than add
more envs for later Python interpreter versions which will be
equally broken, just remove it for now.

Change-Id: I885e6e8899f771cc52a2bf6282fd7bc1ed3083aa

Use oslo.utils

Module `importutils` from common code was graduated to oslo.utils,
so it would be great if we reuse this library.
Remove unused strutils.py and gettextutils.py

subject: Move tripleo-bm-test network to 172.16.0.0/22
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-09-10 22:38:55.000000000', 'files': ['elements/tripleo-cd/configs/te_commonrc', 'elements/tripleo-cd/bin/prepare-ci-overcloud'], 'message': 'Move tripleo-bm-test network to 172.16.0.0/22

We now have enough capacity in one rack to exceed 192.168.1.0/24 so
we agreed at the mid-cycle to scale this up to 172.16.0.0/22 -
allowing room for other uses in the same ip space, but exceeding our
current capacity by a comfortable margin.

Change-Id: I0aa99ec063d9c855e7e49416f0840d3b58a5e202
Co-Authored-By: Derek Higgins <derekh@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Move tripleo-bm-test network to 172.16.0.0/22

We now have enough capacity in one rack to exceed 192.168.1.0/24 so
we agreed at the mid-cycle to scale this up to 172.16.0.0/22 -
allowing room for other uses in the same ip space, but exceeding our
current capacity by a comfortable margin.

Change-Id: I0aa99ec063d9c855e7e49416f0840d3b58a5e202
Co-Authored-By: Derek Higgins <derekh@redhat.com>

commit_message:
HP 3PAR drivers should not claim to have 'infinite' space

The HP 3PAR drivers report 'infinite' space when there is not a limit
set on the CPG. In this case, it would be better to at least use the
free space estimate of the array instead of 'infinite'.

Change-Id: I8c34ea3982fe61a1b6fa01245ca6da23ca5b8b7b
Closes-Bug: 1369057

commit_message:
Add tests for consistency groups DB migration

The consistency group patch added 2 new DB migration versions:
025 and 026. However, there were no unit tests to support them in
cinder/tests/test_migrations.py. This patch added missing tests.

Change-Id: I670825980fddd4b6dc400e5a17e1003ad47ace1a
Closes-Bug: #1370756

Currently we're not checking that the input value requested
for size on volume create is valid, but taskflow portion of
the code expects it to be and as a result when it receives invalid
input we litter the logs with Trace messages.

This patch adds a check that verifies that if we pass in a
size to create_volume in the volume.api that it is in fact

Closes-Bug: 1370773

commit_message:
Verify requested size in volume.api create

Currently we're not checking that the input value requested
for size on volume create is valid, but taskflow portion of
the code expects it to be and as a result when it receives invalid
input we litter the logs with Trace messages.

This patch adds a check that verifies that if we pass in a
size to create_volume in the volume.api that it is in fact
an int or a string representation of an int.

Worst commit ever

Change-Id: I81bf515360eacf63e6f3cdb672ec7f37001aa4fb
Closes-Bug: 1370773

subject: HP 3PAR: Allow retype when the old snapshot CPG (3PAR pool) is None
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2243, 'name': 'John Griffith', 'email': 'john.griffith8@gmail.com', 'username': 'john-griffith'}, {'_account_id': 2759, 'name': 'Huang Zhiteng', 'email': 'winston.d@gmail.com', 'username': 'zhiteng-huang'}, {'_account_id': 4523, 'name': 'Eric Harney', 'email': 'eharney@redhat.com', 'username': 'eharney'}, {'_account_id': 7198, 'name': 'Jay Bryant', 'email': 'jungleboyj@electronicjungle.net', 'username': 'jsbryant'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11047, 'name': 'Mark Sturdevant', 'email': 'mark.sturdevant@ibm.com', 'username': 'markstur'}, {'_account_id': 11811, 'name': 'HP Storage CI', 'email': 'hp.cinder.ci@external.groups.hp.com', 'username': 'hp-cinder-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12017, 'name': 'DellEMC VNX CI', 'email': 'emc.vnx.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-vnx-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12778, 'name': 'HDS HNAS CI', 'email': 'OpenStackDevelopment@hds.com', 'username': 'hds-hnas-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-09-18 04:04:33.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/test_hp3par.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/san/hp/hp_3par_common.py'], 'message': 'HP 3PAR: Allow retype when the old snapshot CPG (3PAR pool) is None

A common provisioning group (CPG) is a virtual pool of logical disks.
A volume is stored in a CPG. The volume's snapshots may be stored in
the same CPG or in a separate CPG. In 3PAR this is the "snapCPG".

Before the 3PAR driver supported "manage", the snapCPG was never None in
OpenStack because when we create volumes, we explicitly default snapCPG
to match the volume CPG unless otherwise specified. So, the original
retype pre-checks raised an exception if this unexpected case occurred
and a unit test was provided for that exception.

Now that we support manage_existing(), it should be a valid use case
to manage an existing volume created outside of OpenStack with a snapCPG
set to None. Unfortunately, when we applied volume-type settings to this
volume we would hit that old exception.

That exception has been removed. 

Removing it required the following changes:

1. When retype pre-checks validate the domain of the new snapCPG, it
   will not use the optional old snapCPG. Instead it will compare the
   new snapCPG domain with the old volume CPG domain. This satisfies
   the requirement that domains cannot be mixed and avoids the need
   to have an old snapCPG setting.

2. Remove the no longer used old_snap_cpg parameter and remove the
   code that raised an exception "if not old_snap_cpg".

3. Remove the unit test that was just to test that obsolete exception.

4. Adjust the exiting test_retype_across_snap_cpg_domains to
   verify that a snapCPG domain that does not match the volume
   CPG domain will still raise Invalid3PARDomain

Change-Id: Icd2c66898ef64f81116df102f5529a8da30c14d5
Closes-Bug: 1368927
'}]
commit_message:
HP 3PAR: Allow retype when the old snapshot CPG (3PAR pool) is None

A common provisioning group (CPG) is a virtual pool of logical disks.
A volume is stored in a CPG. The volume's snapshots may be stored in
the same CPG or in a separate CPG. In 3PAR this is the "snapCPG".

Before the 3PAR driver supported "manage", the snapCPG was never None in
OpenStack because when we create volumes, we explicitly default snapCPG
to match the volume CPG unless otherwise specified. So, the original
retype pre-checks raised an exception if this unexpected case occurred
and a unit test was provided for that exception.

Now that we support manage_existing(), it should be a valid use case
to manage an existing volume created outside of OpenStack with a snapCPG
set to None. Unfortunately, when we applied volume-type settings to this
volume we would hit that old exception.

That exception has been removed. 

Removing it required the following changes:

1. When retype pre-checks validate the domain of the new snapCPG, it
   will not use the optional old snapCPG. Instead it will compare the
   new snapCPG domain with the old volume CPG domain. This satisfies
   the requirement that domains cannot be mixed and avoids the need
   to have an old snapCPG setting.

2. Remove the no longer used old_snap_cpg parameter and remove the
   code that raised an exception "if not old_snap_cpg".

3. Remove the unit test that was just to test that obsolete exception.

4. Adjust the exiting test_retype_across_snap_cpg_domains to
   verify that a snapCPG domain that does not match the volume
   CPG domain will still raise Invalid3PARDomain

Change-Id: Icd2c66898ef64f81116df102f5529a8da30c14d5
Closes-Bug: 1368927

commit_message:
Use right body for test_create_missing_specs_name

Since the test is `test_create_missing_specs_name`, we should define
the the body like `body = {'qos_specs': {'a': 'b'}}`. And add a test
to cover the invalid body case.

Change-Id: Ib1cf9a8b5bfddc0091e28e3765a36c75044642f3
Closes-bug: #1370308

commit_message:
Sync latest strutils from oslo-incubator for mask_password fix

This sync pulls in:
   1131b56 Enable mask_password to handle byte code strings

This is the only update since the last sync:
   beca4db Sync latest strutils from oslo-incubator

This is needed to fix a delete volume failure when processutils
calls mask_password with a byte code string.

Change-Id: Ie8a8c8e26abc0e387830bc9246e9a44913ae9b24
Closes-bug: #1368527

commit_message:
Fix a problem with 'volume list' when 'all_tenants=0'

This change checks the value of 'all_tenants' and returns a list of volumes
for all tenants when 'all_tenants' is 1 (or True). A tenant-specific volume
list is returned when 'all_tenants' is 0 (or False).

An InvalidInput exception is thrown if the 'all_tenants' value is not 0, 1,
True, or False (case insensitive).

Provided new unit tests for the get_all api which check the all_tenants, and
limits parameters.

Fixed pep8 compliance test fails with code being improperly indented, and
changed calls using str() to use six.text_type()

Change-Id: If0b8c343ee7e4e05c9aec89241458dbdf2e4734b
Closes-Bug: #1342046

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4523, 'name': 'Eric Harney', 'email': 'eharney@redhat.com', 'username': 'eharney'}, {'_account_id': 6491, 'name': 'xing-yang', 'email': 'xingyang105@gmail.com', 'username': 'xing-yang'}, {'_account_id': 7198, 'name': 'Jay Bryant', 'email': 'jungleboyj@electronicjungle.net', 'username': 'jsbryant'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9067, 'name': 'Nilesh Bhosale', 'email': 'nilesh.bhosale@in.ibm.com', 'username': 'nileshbhosale'}, {'_account_id': 9171, 'name': 'Vipin Balachandran', 'email': 'vipin.bl@gmail.com', 'username': 'vbala'}, {'_account_id': 12017, 'name': 'DellEMC VNX CI', 'email': 'emc.vnx.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-vnx-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12778, 'name': 'HDS HNAS CI', 'email': 'OpenStackDevelopment@hds.com', 'username': 'hds-hnas-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12780, 'name': 'ProphetStor CI', 'username': 'prophetstor-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13049, 'name': 'Coraid CI', 'email': 'coraid-openstack-ci-all@mirantis.com', 'username': 'coraid-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-09-15 21:05:15.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/test_ibmnas.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/ibm/ibmnas.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/remotefs.py'], 'message': "IBMNAS: Remove call to set r/w permissions to all

During cinder volume create operation from a volume snapshot or
from an existing volume (volume clone operation), the ibmnas
driver sets 'rw' permissions to all, which is unnecessary and
also poses security concerns.
Fixing this issue, removing the calls to set rw permissions to
all during these operations and adding a call to set 'rw'
permissions only to the owner to make sure even if umask is set
at the filesystem level, which might deny 'rw' access to the owner
we explicitely set the required permissions on the volume file.

Change-Id: I0e5ba9262a298e088f7724ddeda3537afa4b023e
Closes-Bug: #1367238
"}]
commit_message:
IBMNAS: Remove call to set r/w permissions to all

During cinder volume create operation from a volume snapshot or
from an existing volume (volume clone operation), the ibmnas
driver sets 'rw' permissions to all, which is unnecessary and
also poses security concerns.
Fixing this issue, removing the calls to set rw permissions to
all during these operations and adding a call to set 'rw'
permissions only to the owner to make sure even if umask is set
at the filesystem level, which might deny 'rw' access to the owner
we explicitely set the required permissions on the volume file.

Change-Id: I0e5ba9262a298e088f7724ddeda3537afa4b023e
Closes-Bug: #1367238

commit_message:
Getting iscsi_ip_address from cinder.conf

In the current version (2.0) of the VMAX driver, we retrieve iSCSI IP
addresses dynamically from SMI-S. However, we ran into situations where
we can't get them reliably during testing. The fix is to get this
information from cinder.conf, just like in version 1.0.

Change-Id: If474f44e99cc45592bacfdec9e1eb2fa48c41e68
Closes-Bug: #1369355

commit_message:
Handle config file with newlines and whitespaces

EMC VMAX driver does not handle newlines and whitespaces
consistently in the XML config file. This patch addressed
this issue.

Change-Id: I45f61f167feee9174ba2bc3229695b680f8e946d
Closes-Bug: #1364232

commit_message:
Ceilometer -- configure vCenter support

Document how to manually configure Ceilometer to report
vCenter metering information.
This could be written up just as a work-around to the bug
but customers are requesting this information so I put the
instructions in the OpsGuide.

An entry in "Known Issues" links to the Ops Guide section.

Change-Id: I7cbe299a79b75f7acdc25b2b655930eb470bdcee
Partial-Bug: 1370700

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-22 17:51:56.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/middleware/auth_token.py'], 'message': "Fix auth_token for old oslo.config

When running with a havana-level of oslo.config (<1.3.0),
applications with any config options in their api-paste.ini will
fail to start with an error like

 'StrOpt' object has no attribute 'type'

This is because the config options didn't have a type attribute
until 1.3.0.

During the grenade test, the havana level of oslo.config is used,
while the master level of keystoneclient is used, and also in the
havana tests the services are still using the keystoneclient
auth_token middleware.

Change-Id: I745c3e04f18941a2d41e191d43f61b926522bb9d
Closes-Bug: #1372422
"}]
commit_message:
Fix auth_token for old oslo.config

When running with a havana-level of oslo.config (<1.3.0),
applications with any config options in their api-paste.ini will
fail to start with an error like

 'StrOpt' object has no attribute 'type'

This is because the config options didn't have a type attribute
until 1.3.0.

During the grenade test, the havana level of oslo.config is used,
while the master level of keystoneclient is used, and also in the
havana tests the services are still using the keystoneclient
auth_token middleware.

Change-Id: I745c3e04f18941a2d41e191d43f61b926522bb9d
Closes-Bug: #1372422

In the Create/Edit Flavor forms and Project Quota forms:

commit_message:
Put units in paranthesis in Create Flavor form

In the Create/Edit Flavor forms and Project Quota forms:
- Admin -> Flavors -> Create/Edit Flavors
- Identity -> Projects -> Create Projects -> Quota

some of the units need to be enclosed within paranthesis to be
consistent with the way units are represented in other form like:
- Admin -> Images -> Create Image
- Project -> Volumes -> Create Volume

Change-Id: I96cd9f6c4fe46e51f462ff29a45182ded15b76dd
Closes-Bug: #1372029

Cinder always returns connection_info with item 'data' now, we should

Change-Id: I118ddb8f4ae34d8dcb62edf38ffa67ad756f3cd7

commit_message:
libvirt: make volume connection info check more clear

Cinder always returns connection_info with item 'data' now, we should
always check this in Nova side. In current logic, missing data in
connection_info can't avoid unnecessary check. This commit twists
little code to make the logic more clear.

Change-Id: I118ddb8f4ae34d8dcb62edf38ffa67ad756f3cd7

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-17 02:08:43.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/api/contrib/qos_specs_manage.py', 'cinder/tests/api/contrib/test_qos_specs_manage.py'], 'message': 'Validate name and key-value for QoS specs

These commands should not be valid -

cinder qos-create " " consumer=back-end " "=" "

cinder qos-key <id> set " "=" "

Validation checks should ensure that non-blank values are entered for
both the QOS spec name and for spec key-value pairs.

Change-Id: I9dda496d5d1f70f543f6f6c417c88cc30d546351
Closes-bug: #1370194
'}]
commit_message:
Validate name and key-value for QoS specs

These commands should not be valid -

cinder qos-create " " consumer=back-end " "=" "

cinder qos-key <id> set " "=" "

Validation checks should ensure that non-blank values are entered for
both the QOS spec name and for spec key-value pairs.

Change-Id: I9dda496d5d1f70f543f6f6c417c88cc30d546351
Closes-bug: #1370194

Calling GET on members in the glance registry no longer returns a
500 Server Error. Since GET isn't supported, it now returns a
405 Method Not Allowed, matching the behavior of members for the
glance api.

Change-Id: I25d7e5f4818a1cdb20788643ae6dd7e277928743
Closes-Bug: #1187395

commit_message:
Fixes Error Calling GET on V1 Registry

Calling GET on members in the glance registry no longer returns a
500 Server Error. Since GET isn't supported, it now returns a
405 Method Not Allowed, matching the behavior of members for the
glance api.

Change-Id: I25d7e5f4818a1cdb20788643ae6dd7e277928743
Closes-Bug: #1187395

commit_message:
Use oslo.serialization

Since module `jsonutils` from common code is graduated in
`oslo.serialization`, we should remove code from oslo-incubator and use this
library.

Change-Id: Ia8b5ef598ff415cdde19f523a36a552918f9f94b

commit_message:
Provide ability to build images for other architectures

Adds binaries specified by user to chroot environment
allowing to build  images on amd64,i386,armhf,arm64
architectures.
Closes-Bug: #1332458
Change-Id: If6e63a472ee85559b93b5e6b96d9c3ddcf7bcc98

subject: Update glance configuration file permission
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-09-23 02:38:24.000000000', 'files': ['templates/default/glance-registry.conf.erb', 'templates/default/glance-api.conf.erb', 'attributes/default.rb', 'recipes/registry.rb', 'spec/api_spec.rb', 'spec/registry_spec.rb', 'CHANGELOG.md', 'recipes/api.rb', 'README.md'], 'message': 'Update glance configuration file permission

Some of glance configuration files contain secrete information like
qpid_password,db connection. To avoid unauthorized users to access it,
change those file permission to 640.

Closes-Bug:#1372330
Change-Id: I556241f09592d82d796de64b76332addc0f81558
'}]
commit_message:
Update glance configuration file permission

Some of glance configuration files contain secrete information like
qpid_password,db connection. To avoid unauthorized users to access it,
change those file permission to 640.

Closes-Bug:#1372330
Change-Id: I556241f09592d82d796de64b76332addc0f81558

subject: Fix .push python-ibm-db-django polluting common attribute
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-18 17:15:12.000000000', 'files': ['attributes/default.rb', 'CHANGELOG.md', 'recipes/server.rb'], 'message': 'Fix .push python-ibm-db-django polluting common attribute

A Common attribute was having a dashboard specific package added to it.
This has side effects as it will effect other cookbooks using that attribute.

* Create attrbute to hold dashboard specific database packages
* Tests unchanged as they are still correct outcome

Change-Id: I9dae9dfc7a118203a80492160514cbf7d0f975e9
Closes-Bug: #1364508
'}]
commit_message:
Fix .push python-ibm-db-django polluting common attribute

A Common attribute was having a dashboard specific package added to it.
This has side effects as it will effect other cookbooks using that attribute.

* Create attrbute to hold dashboard specific database packages
* Tests unchanged as they are still correct outcome

Change-Id: I9dae9dfc7a118203a80492160514cbf7d0f975e9
Closes-Bug: #1364508

subject: Register provider succeeds when failures occur
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-17 20:17:15.000000000', 'files': ['spec/register_spec.rb', 'providers/register.rb', 'CHANGELOG.md'], 'message': 'Register provider succeeds when failures occur

The provider actions where capturing the keystone cmd error and just
logging them as errors to the log, resulting in a converged node that
is unusable.  These errors should be raised as exceptions to allow
for these configuration errors to be debugged earlier.

Change-Id: I0990dc8386f5999dc96b6cedfca86a762f031953
Closes-Bug: #1370678
'}]
commit_message:
Register provider succeeds when failures occur

The provider actions where capturing the keystone cmd error and just
logging them as errors to the log, resulting in a converged node that
is unusable.  These errors should be raised as exceptions to allow
for these configuration errors to be debugged earlier.

Change-Id: I0990dc8386f5999dc96b6cedfca86a762f031953
Closes-Bug: #1370678

commit_message:
Add sensitive flag to openrc resource

Use to ensure that sensitive resource data is not logged by the chef-client.
Need to update Foodcritic to 4.0 to handle new sensitive attribute.

Change-Id: Ibc115969278f58e8baa01fb7f20303f88aa2ded5
Closes-Bug: #1365113

commit_message:
NSX plugin: set VNIC_TYPE port binding attribute

A recent change has made this attribute required for nova
integration.
This patch adds this attribute to responses generated by the NSX
plugin, and also ensures relevant unit tests are executed for the
vmware NSX plugin.

Change-Id: Ieebab01b406909f66a40cc683763292a9ef6f218
Closes-Bug: #1370112

commit_message:
Backward compatibility to credentials in conf

Before switching to the YAML based configuration as the default for
credentials, we need to introduce backward compatibility to allow
credentials to be configured in tempest.conf.

Partially implements bp:test-accounts

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-20 22:04:37.000000000', 'files': ['features.yaml'], 'message': "Disable cinder with ironic

Cinder doesn't currently work with ironic as volumes cannot yet
be attached to baremetal nodes. This is something that may be
available in the K series. For now, though, so that we can work
on enabling the tempest API and scenario tests with ironic, we
need to disable cinder.

Change-Id: I783d3c8539acc2e74922a8aad98f0c7928b3815e
"}]
commit_message:
Disable cinder with ironic

Cinder doesn't currently work with ironic as volumes cannot yet
be attached to baremetal nodes. This is something that may be
available in the K series. For now, though, so that we can work
on enabling the tempest API and scenario tests with ironic, we
need to disable cinder.

Change-Id: I783d3c8539acc2e74922a8aad98f0c7928b3815e

subject: Ensure requirements-py2 is synced
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-09-20 16:21:22.000000000', 'files': ['update.py'], 'message': 'Ensure requirements-py2 is synced

PBR supports files of the style requirements-pyN where N is the
bundling python version, which means we need to sync the same number
of supported possible PBR files that can exist.

This adds in the missing py2 that was not being synced even though
it is a viable requirements file for PBR.

Fixes bug 1371936

Change-Id: I7956d77c275694cf09971766d16af054d2692261
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure requirements-py2 is synced

PBR supports files of the style requirements-pyN where N is the
bundling python version, which means we need to sync the same number
of supported possible PBR files that can exist.

This adds in the missing py2 that was not being synced even though
it is a viable requirements file for PBR.

Fixes bug 1371936

Change-Id: I7956d77c275694cf09971766d16af054d2692261

subject: Allow WBE request transition timeout to be dynamic
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-08-12 19:30:11.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/engines/worker_based/engine.py', 'taskflow/engines/worker_based/executor.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/worker_based/test_engine.py'], 'message': 'Allow WBE request transition timeout to be dynamic

To enable longer (or shorter) timeouts for a WBE submitted
request to transition out of the (PENDING, WAITING) states
allow the transition timeout that was previously set to 60
seconds to be provided as a WBE configuration option (it
still defaults to the previously fixed 60 seconds when it
is not provided).

Fixes bug 1356002

Change-Id: Idf384217004a334df03e2fff9150309fdfe08005
'}]
commit_message:
Allow WBE request transition timeout to be dynamic

To enable longer (or shorter) timeouts for a WBE submitted
request to transition out of the (PENDING, WAITING) states
allow the transition timeout that was previously set to 60
seconds to be provided as a WBE configuration option (it
still defaults to the previously fixed 60 seconds when it
is not provided).

Fixes bug 1356002

Change-Id: Idf384217004a334df03e2fff9150309fdfe08005

commit_message:
Record instance faults during boot process

Once a build makes it to the compute manager build_and_run_instance
method no instance faults were being recorded.  This stores the instance
faults appropriately when an instance is placed into the ERROR state.

Change-Id: I348b539d0b5874bac3f7443e6dd4524264ce9766
Closes-Bug: #1355922

subject: Reject WBE messages if they can't be put in an ack state
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-09-02 18:06:19.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/engines/worker_based/dispatcher.py'], 'message': "Reject WBE messages if they can't be put in an ack state

Attempt to reject messages that could not be acknowledged
so that those messages could be resent (requeueing is not
appropriate since it will just cause the message to come
back).

Fixes bug 1364543

Change-Id: I2cb33b39be950528fa9e22d9a11722bedd0927aa
"}]
commit_message:
Reject WBE messages if they can't be put in an ack state

Attempt to reject messages that could not be acknowledged
so that those messages could be resent (requeueing is not
appropriate since it will just cause the message to come
back).

Fixes bug 1364543

Change-Id: I2cb33b39be950528fa9e22d9a11722bedd0927aa

subject: LOG which requeue filter callback failed
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-08-12 17:48:38.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/engines/worker_based/dispatcher.py'], 'message': 'LOG which requeue filter callback failed

When a requeue filter fails being called instead of just
logging the exception and traceback also log the callback
index which failed and the string representation of the
callback that failed so that when/if it is later examined to
determine the root cause these pieces of output can be used
to isolate the failing callback.

Also includes a drive-by commit to update the add requeue
filter callback documentation to explain what the callback
will be provided and expected to return.

Change-Id: Idf1ae63cfa706551ac0361e802f3b082783e0b9d
'}]
commit_message:
LOG which requeue filter callback failed

When a requeue filter fails being called instead of just
logging the exception and traceback also log the callback
index which failed and the string representation of the
callback that failed so that when/if it is later examined to
determine the root cause these pieces of output can be used
to isolate the failing callback.

Also includes a drive-by commit to update the add requeue
filter callback documentation to explain what the callback
will be provided and expected to return.

Change-Id: Idf1ae63cfa706551ac0361e802f3b082783e0b9d

The fakelibvirt.Connection class, among other things, mocks
libvirt.virConnect which doesn't require any parameters. This is
causing a test to fail.

Change-Id: If77864cb0d0bd1dae20b490b8e87a32a0951b52e

commit_message:
Add default arguments for Connection class

The fakelibvirt.Connection class, among other things, mocks
libvirt.virConnect which doesn't require any parameters. This is
causing a test to fail.

Change-Id: If77864cb0d0bd1dae20b490b8e87a32a0951b52e
Closes-Bug: 1257876
(cherry picked from commit aded4a72b70d936df2771d1a6d35dd71e356de71)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-26 19:12:57.000000000', 'files': ['reference/programs.yaml'], 'message': 'Add reference to neutronincubator project

The Neutron Incubator project is a common place for the Neutron team to
incubate API and service extensions prior to declaring the extension
stable. The incubator will not participate in the integrated
release as items that graduate will be move to an integrated project or
spun out into a new project.

Change-Id: Ib47430d0f9e20801e9e974697e4428083d1b9d19
'}]
commit_message:
Add reference to neutronincubator project

The Neutron Incubator project is a common place for the Neutron team to
incubate API and service extensions prior to declaring the extension
stable. The incubator will not participate in the integrated
release as items that graduate will be move to an integrated project or
spun out into a new project.

Change-Id: Ib47430d0f9e20801e9e974697e4428083d1b9d19

commit_message:
Add pip-missing-reqs tox env

It checks that all of the imported from sahara requirements directly
specified in the requirements.txt file. It's needed to keep all of our
requirements corresponding to imports in code.

Sample output - https://gist.github.com/Frostman/bbc00bd386f317a1160e

Change-Id: I7f792fb59b07eb1a6cb7cd51a1ff0e759da6f68c

commit_message:
Add genconfig tox env

It'll generate the config sample to etc/sahara/

It could be used by developers to generate the latest version of config
to avoid pep8 check errors (pep8 checks that config is fresh).

Change-Id: Ia942d2558317ae5aa46fce4e869ef0323758210d

subject: Fix enabled emulation naming attribute calculation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-22 22:42:10.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/ldap/core.py'], 'message': "Fix enabled emulation naming attribute calculation

The calculation for the enabled emulation entry's naming attribute
was done using _dn_to_id. While this works, that method should be
used for calculating the ID for normal user or group entries.

With this change, the enabled emulation entry's naming attribute is
computed when the DN is computed, since in that case the server is
either constructing the DN or getting it from the config.

Change-Id: I795ac428446a67de2794ef71297b4343dbfaf5ea
Related-Bug: #1340041
"}]
commit_message:
Fix enabled emulation naming attribute calculation

The calculation for the enabled emulation entry's naming attribute
was done using _dn_to_id. While this works, that method should be
used for calculating the ID for normal user or group entries.

With this change, the enabled emulation entry's naming attribute is
computed when the DN is computed, since in that case the server is
either constructing the DN or getting it from the config.

Change-Id: I795ac428446a67de2794ef71297b4343dbfaf5ea
Related-Bug: #1340041

commit_message:
ironic/baremetal: add validation of host manager/state APIs

Add tests to ensure the ironic & baremetal HostManager and
HostState sub-classes comply with the API contract defined
in their parent class.

Related-bug: #1369151
Change-Id: Ic2cf17c59c06fe2222db4bc5ea0e68f87c4399e9

commit_message:
Initial creation of db models, modules, and tests

Added sqlalchemy models mirroring initial migration
Added engine and session methods based off oslo.db
Added base db test based off of oslo.db
Added model tests
Added data models
Added data model tests
Added migration for one to many load balancer to amphora
Added migration for name and URL size changes
Added smarter comparison method for data models

Implements: blueprint initial-db-models

Change-Id: I8421093f0952d5e3ef287bfd4979cc5a83af6c09

subject: Fixing the PYTHONHASHSEED bug with our unittests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-13 19:54:58.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/tests/api/test_resources_policy.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Fixing the PYTHONHASHSEED bug with our unittests

Switching from HTTPInternalServerError to HTTPServerError
as Pecan seems to be returning HTTPServerError instead.
For some reason the assertion only fails with specific
PYTHONHASHSEED's. As a result, I'm just making sure we
assert against the returned exception to correct the
issue for the moment.

Change-Id: Iad15fa17fc2c4d5c3642462df25e702aaff4801f
Partial-bug: #1348818
"}]
commit_message:
Fixing the PYTHONHASHSEED bug with our unittests

Switching from HTTPInternalServerError to HTTPServerError
as Pecan seems to be returning HTTPServerError instead.
For some reason the assertion only fails with specific
PYTHONHASHSEED's. As a result, I'm just making sure we
assert against the returned exception to correct the
issue for the moment.

Change-Id: Iad15fa17fc2c4d5c3642462df25e702aaff4801f
Partial-bug: #1348818

subject: Stop using intersphinx
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-13 07:49:22.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py'], 'message': "Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910
"}]
commit_message:
Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-21 13:22:28.000000000', 'files': ['hacking/checks/dictlist.py', 'HACKING.rst'], 'message': 'Update H501 to check for self.__dict__

There was a bug in Cinder where log formatting
of a translated i18n message with self.__dict__
caused the cinder API service to hang on py26.

Update the hacking rule for locals() in formatting
operations to also check for usage of self.__dict__.

Change-Id: Ie358c4140471b776fecb3430e0131e5b80382689
Closes-Bug: #1366031
Related-Bug: #1365901
'}]
commit_message:
Update H501 to check for self.__dict__

There was a bug in Cinder where log formatting
of a translated i18n message with self.__dict__
caused the cinder API service to hang on py26.

Update the hacking rule for locals() in formatting
operations to also check for usage of self.__dict__.

Change-Id: Ie358c4140471b776fecb3430e0131e5b80382689
Closes-Bug: #1366031
Related-Bug: #1365901

commit_message:
Added check for Cinder services

After cluster nodes restart, volumes creation are failed
for several minutes because cinder services are down
due to rabbitmq is not ready yet. We need wait until
cinder-scheduler and cinder-volumes are up on controllers
before doing OSTF tests.

Change-Id: Ie9c35368e0f5e399ee2fe69c7132a4232fe40690
Closes-Bug: #1363994

commit_message:
Added check for Cinder services

After cluster nodes restart, volumes creation are failed
for several minutes because cinder services are down
due to rabbitmq is not ready yet. We need wait until
cinder-scheduler and cinder-volumes are up on controllers
before doing OSTF tests.

Change-Id: Ie9c35368e0f5e399ee2fe69c7132a4232fe40690
Closes-Bug: #1363994

subject: Fix post_install.d for Fedora distribution
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-09-22 18:01:19.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/files/elements/fedora-guest/post-install.d/90-yum-update', 'scripts/files/elements/fedora-guest/post-install.d/90-apt-get-update'], 'message': "Fix post_install.d for Fedora distribution

Reasons:
 - Fedora is not Ubuntu
 - Fedora uses 'yum' for software management

Changes:
 - renaming file '90-apt-get-update' to '90-yum-update'
 - swapping 'apt-get update' to 'yum update'

Change-Id: I212ab76ff6e302efcc955d26b7b1d978e4f204ca
Closes-Bug: #1371210
"}]
commit_message:
Fix post_install.d for Fedora distribution

Reasons:
 - Fedora is not Ubuntu
 - Fedora uses 'yum' for software management

Changes:
 - renaming file '90-apt-get-update' to '90-yum-update'
 - swapping 'apt-get update' to 'yum update'

Change-Id: I212ab76ff6e302efcc955d26b7b1d978e4f204ca
Closes-Bug: #1371210

commit_message:
Fix high CPU usage in VMs when RBD images are used

It's recommended to use io="native" with rbd/lvm images:

http://www.sebastien-han.fr/blog/2013/08/12/openstack-unexplained-high-cpu-load-on-compute-nodes

Change-Id: Ib55623f2f2b8c13916aa423f0ae24a4916b65666

revisions:
[{'number': 22, 'created': '2014-09-22 11:17:40.000000000', 'files': ['rally/benchmark/processing/utils.py', 'tests/benchmark/runners/test_base.py', 'tests/benchmark/scenarios/keystone/test_utils.py', 'tests/benchmark/scenarios/test_base.py', 'tests/benchmark/scenarios/ceilometer/test_utils.py', 'tests/benchmark/scenarios/cinder/test_utils.py', 'tests/benchmark/scenarios/neutron/test_utils.py', 'rally/benchmark/scenarios/base.py', 'tests/benchmark/scenarios/heat/test_utils.py', 'rally/benchmark/processing/charts/histogram.py', 'tests/benchmark/processing/test_utils.py', 'tests/benchmark/scenarios/designate/test_utils.py', 'tests/benchmark/scenarios/sahara/test_utils.py', 'tests/benchmark/scenarios/quotas/test_utils.py', 'rally/benchmark/runners/base.py', 'tests/benchmark/scenarios/glance/test_utils.py', 'tests/benchmark/scenarios/nova/test_utils.py', 'rally/cmd/commands/task.py', 'tests/benchmark/processing/test_plot.py', 'rally/benchmark/processing/plot.py', 'tests/benchmark/runners/test_serial.py'], 'message': 'Add atomic action names tracking

Here we change the format of the scenario results so that it now stores
the atomic actions data as a dict:

    Before:
        {
            "duration": ...,
            "error": ...,
            "atomic_actions": [
                {"action": "a1", "duration": 0.3},
                {"action": "a2", "duration": 0.1},
                {"action": "a1", "duration": 0.25}
            ],
            ...
        }

    After:
        {
            "duration": ...,
            "error": ...,
            "atomic_actions": {
                "a1": 0.3,
                "a1 (2)": 0.25,
                "a2": 0.1
            },
            ...
        }

We also solve 2 connected problems here:

1. The statistics table that shows up in the CLI after benchmarks complete now
   always has rows for all the atomic actions that were invoked in benchmark
   scenarios. Before this patch, this was not the case since occasionally the
   atomic actions data could not be written due to Exceptions.

2. We've removed lots of ugly code in benchmark/processing/plot.py, since now
   there is no need to make passes through the atomic actions data to collect
   their names.

This patch also:
* contains some removing of code duplicate between plot & CLI output generation;
* adds missing UTs for raw benchmark data processing;
* fixes a minor bug in histograms bins number calculation.

Change-Id: I17f563051bd1c2ec2fb47a385d4cc652895e1f9e
'}]
commit_message:
Add atomic action names tracking

Here we change the format of the scenario results so that it now stores
the atomic actions data as a dict:

    Before:
        {
            "duration": ...,
            "error": ...,
            "atomic_actions": [
                {"action": "a1", "duration": 0.3},
                {"action": "a2", "duration": 0.1},
                {"action": "a1", "duration": 0.25}
            ],
            ...
        }

    After:
        {
            "duration": ...,
            "error": ...,
            "atomic_actions": {
                "a1": 0.3,
                "a1 (2)": 0.25,
                "a2": 0.1
            },
            ...
        }

We also solve 2 connected problems here:

1. The statistics table that shows up in the CLI after benchmarks complete now
   always has rows for all the atomic actions that were invoked in benchmark
   scenarios. Before this patch, this was not the case since occasionally the
   atomic actions data could not be written due to Exceptions.

2. We've removed lots of ugly code in benchmark/processing/plot.py, since now
   there is no need to make passes through the atomic actions data to collect
   their names.

This patch also:
* contains some removing of code duplicate between plot & CLI output generation;
* adds missing UTs for raw benchmark data processing;
* fixes a minor bug in histograms bins number calculation.

Change-Id: I17f563051bd1c2ec2fb47a385d4cc652895e1f9e

commit_message:
Handle @s in log file names by renaming them

Rabbit log files are bad and use @ in the filename. Replace @ with _at_
to prevent the log server from 404ing on these files.

Change-Id: I6daaf0475b1dab6bcd56c4d838f4600271d6a8be

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-15 10:15:10.000000000', 'files': ['nova/crypto.py'], 'message': 'NIST: increase RSA key length to 2048 bit

According to NIST 800-131A, RSA key lenght for digital signature
must >= 2048 bit. Now we use 1024 bit key to generate x509 cert
file. Need to increase the key length to 2048 bit.

Change-Id: I59f614b5d8a79f9e0a96503867cfca176be5c757
Closes-Bug: 1369487
'}]
commit_message:
NIST: increase RSA key length to 2048 bit

According to NIST 800-131A, RSA key lenght for digital signature
must >= 2048 bit. Now we use 1024 bit key to generate x509 cert
file. Need to increase the key length to 2048 bit.

Change-Id: I59f614b5d8a79f9e0a96503867cfca176be5c757
Closes-Bug: 1369487

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-22 20:49:15.000000000', 'files': ['Berksfile.lock'], 'message': "Added fix for dependacy for mysql-chef_gem

Bumped the version to 0.0.4 that has a fix for ubuntu ruby191-dev.
The error this resolves is this:
```ruby
        /usr/bin/ruby1.9.1 extconf.rb
/usr/lib/ruby/1.9.1/rubygems/custom_require.rb:36:in `require': cannot load such file -- mkmf (LoadError)
	from /usr/lib/ruby/1.9.1/rubygems/custom_require.rb:36:in `require'
	from extconf.rb:5:in `<main>'
```

Change-Id: I8a6d8f06d97cd5adfe40c9cbde13b10bd3d58f1e
"}]
commit_message:
Added fix for dependacy for mysql-chef_gem

Bumped the version to 0.0.4 that has a fix for ubuntu ruby191-dev.
The error this resolves is this:
```ruby
        /usr/bin/ruby1.9.1 extconf.rb
/usr/lib/ruby/1.9.1/rubygems/custom_require.rb:36:in `require': cannot load such file -- mkmf (LoadError)
	from /usr/lib/ruby/1.9.1/rubygems/custom_require.rb:36:in `require'
	from extconf.rb:5:in `<main>'
```

Change-Id: I8a6d8f06d97cd5adfe40c9cbde13b10bd3d58f1e

commit_message:
Fix ansible element to build standalone

The ansible element relies on many libraries and tools that tend to be
present when OpenStack components are built. However, this makes it work
standalone without any other elements.

commit_message:
Updates API name

Zaqar is a messaging service which provides support for different
messaging patterns and messaging related semantics.
This fix changes the old API name -queuing- to a more accurate name, -messaging-.

Change-Id: Icaf67607de962217819f8040abca7dd9b81aa1d4

subject: Stop using intersphinx
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-13 13:11:45.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py'], 'message': "Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Closes-Bug: #1368910
"}]
commit_message:
Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Closes-Bug: #1368910
