commit_message:
Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Closes-Bug: #1368910

commit_message:

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-09-19 00:22:37.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Add a pep8 testenv

To allow us to start thinking about using bashate for our scripts, I've
added a pep8 testenv, which runs bashate and only bashate. The confusing
name is because we expect to add flake8 to this environment later, and
we want the name to be consistent with other projects.

Currently I'm seeing 419 errors; largely trailing whitespace,
indentation, and function calls using the 'wrong' format.

Change-Id: Ibc04e00d4278e3656e1e5981a6c1b646cd61f39f
"}]
commit_message:
Add a pep8 testenv

To allow us to start thinking about using bashate for our scripts, I've
added a pep8 testenv, which runs bashate and only bashate. The confusing
name is because we expect to add flake8 to this environment later, and
we want the name to be consistent with other projects.

Currently I'm seeing 419 errors; largely trailing whitespace,
indentation, and function calls using the 'wrong' format.

Change-Id: Ibc04e00d4278e3656e1e5981a6c1b646cd61f39f

commit_message:
Do not set the context twice when forming RPC objects

The context is already being set once the object is instantiated so
there's no need to set it again. This patch fixes that and update tests
to validate if the right context has been added to the object.

Change-Id: I7eb3d734a990eb70e4fbfce6c539b268900b5241
Partial-Bug: #1314732

commit_message:
Handle SNMP exception error.PySnmpError

In ironic.drivers.modules.snmp.py, SNMPClient._get_transport() could
raise an SNMP exception. This is now caught and the ironic exception
SNMPFailure is raised instead.

Change-Id: I8816729b1b9483c213bb9e94b0816a88e609a91d
Partial-Bug: #1267693

subject: Handle volume bdm not found in lvm.get_volume_size
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5441, 'name': 'Andrew Laski', 'email': 'andrew@lascii.com', 'username': 'alaski'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-19 21:48:38.000000000', 'files': ['nova/exception.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_lvm.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/lvm.py'], 'message': "Handle volume bdm not found in lvm.get_volume_size

We're stack tracing in successful gate runs because of a race when
deleting an instance and when the update_available_resource periodic
task is running.

When we hit the race, the volume that's backing the instance is deleted
and the periodic task (virt driver) is trying to get the current
information about the volume, which no longer exists and we fail and
short-circuit the update_available_resource task.

This change adds a decorator which checks if a ProcessExecutionError is
due to the device no longer existing and if so, raises
VolumeBDMPathNotFound, and applies that decorator to the get_volume_size
method.

Related-Bug: #1371677

Change-Id: Ic452df82c61087efda8d742e030076421c0c813b
"}]
commit_message:
Handle volume bdm not found in lvm.get_volume_size

We're stack tracing in successful gate runs because of a race when
deleting an instance and when the update_available_resource periodic
task is running.

When we hit the race, the volume that's backing the instance is deleted
and the periodic task (virt driver) is trying to get the current
information about the volume, which no longer exists and we fail and
short-circuit the update_available_resource task.

This change adds a decorator which checks if a ProcessExecutionError is
due to the device no longer existing and if so, raises
VolumeBDMPathNotFound, and applies that decorator to the get_volume_size
method.

Related-Bug: #1371677

Change-Id: Ic452df82c61087efda8d742e030076421c0c813b

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-09-21 18:55:47.000000000', 'files': ['lib/keystone', 'lib/horizon'], 'message': "Configurable token hashing algorithm

The Keystone server and auth_token middleware were enhanced to
support a configurable hash algorithm.

With this change, the user can set

 KEYSTONE_TOKEN_HASH_ALGORITHM=sha256

in their localrc to use the SHA256 algorithm rather than the
default md5. Any hash algorithm supported by Python's hashlib can
be used. The MD5 algorithm doesn't provide enough protection from
hash collisions and some security standards mandate a SHA2 hash
algorithm.

Change-Id: I8b373291ceb760a03c4c14aebfeb53d8d0dfbcc1
Closes-Bug: #1174499
"}]
commit_message:
Configurable token hashing algorithm

The Keystone server and auth_token middleware were enhanced to
support a configurable hash algorithm.

With this change, the user can set

 KEYSTONE_TOKEN_HASH_ALGORITHM=sha256

in their localrc to use the SHA256 algorithm rather than the
default md5. Any hash algorithm supported by Python's hashlib can
be used. The MD5 algorithm doesn't provide enough protection from
hash collisions and some security standards mandate a SHA2 hash
algorithm.

Change-Id: I8b373291ceb760a03c4c14aebfeb53d8d0dfbcc1
Closes-Bug: #1174499

commit_message:
Function for auth_token middleware config

Each project was configuring the auth_token middleware using several
lines of inisets. Since all the projects should configure the
auth_token middleware in the same way create a function and call it.

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-09-19 13:27:09.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/firewalls/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/firewalls/forms.py', 'openstack_dashboard/test/test_data/neutron_data.py'], 'message': "Handle correctly protocol 'ANY' in firewall rule

Currently horizon allows to create firewall rule with protocol == 'ANY'
but horizon crashs if you try to update such rule because UpdateRule
assumes that protocol is a string and fails to convert it to uppercase
if protocol is ANY/None. Moreover horizon does not allow to update
protocol to 'ANY' despite neutron supports it.

This change updates UpdateRule in order to convert correctly ANY to
None and vice versa. It allows also to update firewall rule protocol to
ANY.

Closes-Bug: #1324382
Closes-Bug: #1370485
Change-Id: I5748b8e6c1cf0ef0d7a4317016492e064b5e8918
"}]
commit_message:
Handle correctly protocol 'ANY' in firewall rule

Currently horizon allows to create firewall rule with protocol == 'ANY'
but horizon crashs if you try to update such rule because UpdateRule
assumes that protocol is a string and fails to convert it to uppercase
if protocol is ANY/None. Moreover horizon does not allow to update
protocol to 'ANY' despite neutron supports it.

This change updates UpdateRule in order to convert correctly ANY to
None and vice versa. It allows also to update firewall rule protocol to
ANY.

Closes-Bug: #1324382
Closes-Bug: #1370485
Change-Id: I5748b8e6c1cf0ef0d7a4317016492e064b5e8918

Enable glance keystone authtoken configurations

This patch is for allowing cafile, insecure,
memcached_servers, memcache_security_strategy,
memcache_secret_key and hash_algorithms to be
configurable.

Closes-Bug: #1370908

commit_message:
Add some authtoken related attributes

This change adds some attributes into the cookbook so
that they are configurable. It mainly includes:
cafile, memcached_servers, memcache_security_strategy,
memcache_secret_key, insecure and hash_algorithms.

Change-Id: I97877cf5ce48bd70b9cb2ff12b1fdffbd5a7a69d
Closes-Bug: #1371438

We may want to set hash_algorithm to be 'sha2', so we
should allow hash_algorithm to be configurable.

commit_message:
Big Switch: Pass tenant names to backend

Records the received tenant names corresponding to tenant IDs
received in requests to a DB. This DB is then referenced
whenever providing a tenant_id in a port or network request to
the backend so the tenant_name can also be included if it is
available.

Implements: blueprint bigswitch-tenantnames
Change-Id: I18882dab057c0040ad56f99f68c5a7a95a8184b4

commit_message:
Making section id names readable in security guide

In the security guide, the section id names are the chapter name
with a random id number on the end. This is harder to work with and not
really necessary. Replacing random id number with actual section names.

Changing the ids at the section definitions for all the sections throughout.
References to these ids are also updated.

Change-Id: Id4aa5df8c7c025ae7a812f1b031041b14002c030
Closes-bug: #1340388

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-09-19 18:35:38.000000000', 'files': ['specs/juno/common/no-secret-attributes.rst'], 'message': 'Keep sensitive information out of node attributes

Sensitive information stored in data bags (such as passwords) should
not be stored as node attributes, because they are persisted back to
the server and can therefore be easily retrieved.

Change-Id: I26c1fc1d49a86d8f9ccb6f1a80af90a781c1a80c
'}]
commit_message:
Keep sensitive information out of node attributes

Sensitive information stored in data bags (such as passwords) should
not be stored as node attributes, because they are persisted back to
the server and can therefore be easily retrieved.

Change-Id: I26c1fc1d49a86d8f9ccb6f1a80af90a781c1a80c

commit_message:
Update to latest oslo.vmware

The new release contains the following changes:
* Fix seek and tell in BlockingQueue
* Add DuplicateName exception
* Add ‘details’ property to VMwareDriverException
* Enable oslo.i18n for oslo.vmware
* Add API to enable calling module to register an exception
* Imported Translations from Transifex
* Add docs target and generate api docs
* Updated from global requirements
* Work toward Python 3.4 support and testing
* warn against sorting requirements
* Add exception for TaskInProgress
* Updated from global requirements
* Refactoring to reduce noise in log files
* Imported Translations from Transifex
* Add missing session parameter to get_summary
* Updated from global requirements
* Switch off caching to prevent cache poisoning by local attacker
* Support for copying streamOptimized disk to file
* Add support for the DatastoreURL object
* Add methods to the Datastore objects
* Imported Translations from Transifex
* Add Pylint testenv environment

Needed by review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/121479/ which is for bug 1369463

Related-Bug: #1369463
Closes-Bug: #1341954
Change-Id: I281c76f0010ca705e4159e1036712d7c08983412

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-19 07:36:01.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/extensions/federation.rst'], 'message': 'Add info about pysaml2 into federation docs.

pysaml2 is only required for Keystone2Keystone federation. Due to code
structure, ``pysaml2`` needs to be installed in order to enable
federation extension. Since federation is an extension all the
dependencies are not in the requirements.txt file and will not be
installed by default. This patch updates federation docs adding
information that the library must be installed by hand.

Change-Id: Icc0b3b5cc0e22950a85bb58bbd3631c911be8621
'}]
commit_message:
Add info about pysaml2 into federation docs.

pysaml2 is only required for Keystone2Keystone federation. Due to code
structure, ``pysaml2`` needs to be installed in order to enable
federation extension. Since federation is an extension all the
dependencies are not in the requirements.txt file and will not be
installed by default. This patch updates federation docs adding
information that the library must be installed by hand.

Change-Id: Icc0b3b5cc0e22950a85bb58bbd3631c911be8621

This change adds more detail to the error message
when a request to soft reboot an instance in an
invalid state fails, indicating that specifically
soft reboot is the request that failed, when
a hard reboot might still succeed.

Change-Id: I4b12aa261d1c4fa05bacd5311793ed6e0478e59b
'}]
commit_message:
Update invalid state error message on reboot API

This change adds more detail to the error message
when a request to soft reboot an instance in an
invalid state fails, indicating that specifically
soft reboot is the request that failed, when
a hard reboot might still succeed.

Closes-Bug: 1365683

Change-Id: I4b12aa261d1c4fa05bacd5311793ed6e0478e59b

commit_message:
Adding OSSN-0029 - Neutron FWaaS rule bug

Neutron FWaaS rules lack port restrictions when using a protocol
other than 'tcp' or 'udp', e.g. 'any'.

Closes-bug: #1365961

Change-Id: I14a08e6fc2357bbaeb6a37b28f9f9ecd81390219

commit_message:
Make context mandatory when instantiating a RPC object

RPC objects should have a context within it, this patch is making passing
the context mandatory when instantiating the object and is a plumbing
work to remove passing the context later for things like create(),
refresh(), destroy() and save().

Partial-Bug: #1314732
Change-Id: If9b175fa874bcb96c77cf22d176f1111f450f796

commit_message:
Use oslo.serialization

Module `jsonutils` from common code was graduated to oslo.serialization,
so it would be great if we reuse this library.
Remove unused log.py and fileutils.py

Change-Id: Ie7d80df501296b4b06da8c1cc155bcc4b64bfe28

List role assignments calls should return
'inherited_to_projects': 'projects' for an
inherited assignment.
This behavior is not valid on KVS. This patch
fix it and add a test.

Change-Id: I6f33d7226eb617d7e72f0a0be1ee0088a3485749
Closes-Bug: 1360406

commit_message:
Fix return from list role assignments on KVS

List role assignments calls should return
'inherited_to_projects': 'projects' for an
inherited assignment.
This behavior is not valid on KVS. This patch
fix it and add a test.

Change-Id: I6f33d7226eb617d7e72f0a0be1ee0088a3485749
Closes-Bug: 1360406

commit_message:
Use non-deprecated notification_driver

Designate is using oslo.messaging so it should be
using 'messaging' as its notification driver and not the now deprecated
full python path to the oslo-incubator notification driver.

Change-Id: Ic6896ce2606dd8d86a4c96ff570c51f3db4ac399

Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5292, 'name': 'Christopher Yeoh', 'email': 'cbkyeoh@gmail.com', 'username': 'cyeoh-0'}, {'_account_id': 8412, 'name': 'Mike Durnosvistov', 'email': 'glacierr.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'mdurnosvistov'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-15 22:48:47.000000000', 'files': ['run_func_tests.py', 'nova/tests/functional/test_flavors.py', '.gitignore', 'nova/tests/functional/fixtures.py', 'nova/tests/functional/__init__.py', 'nova/tests/functional/environment.py', 'nova/tests/functional/test_versions.py', 'nova/tests/functional/base.py'], 'message': 'Adds new functional test suite for API samples

The existing functional test suite in Nova (in nova/tests/integrated)
suffers from terrible performance due to it spinning up a Nova
environment containing an API WSGI service endpoint, service daemons
for nova-conductor, nova-compute, nova-consoleauth, and running database
migrations for each test method of every test case class in the
test_api_samples.py test file.

All most of the api samples tests do is issue a simple HTTP request
against the API WSGI service endpoint and compare the results it gets
back to a stored api sample document in doc/api_samples/. It is not a
particularly CPU or memory-intensive test, but due to the framework
creating and recreating the Nova environment over and over, typical
runtimes of the nova/tests/integrated/test_api_samples.py tests can take
more than 5 minutes.

This patch adds a new functional test suite for running these kinds of
tests. It sets up a single Nova environment, loads a database and
fixtures, runs the tests, and then tears down the Nova environment.

This patch just adds tests for flavors and versions, in order to keep
the patch size manageable. The tests themselves have not actually
changed, and the new base test class for the functional tests shares 90%
of the code in the existing nova/tests/integrated/api_sample_test_base
file except the Nova environment is not created and recreated in setUp()
and tearDown() each time a test method is run.

The result is that the tests run in a fraction of the time that the
existing integrated tests run.

Change-Id: Ic5d186e33a3f423a38beb64b485eb7f6467ced29
'}]
commit_message:
Adds new functional test suite for API samples

The existing functional test suite in Nova (in nova/tests/integrated)
suffers from terrible performance due to it spinning up a Nova
environment containing an API WSGI service endpoint, service daemons
for nova-conductor, nova-compute, nova-consoleauth, and running database
migrations for each test method of every test case class in the
test_api_samples.py test file.

All most of the api samples tests do is issue a simple HTTP request
against the API WSGI service endpoint and compare the results it gets
back to a stored api sample document in doc/api_samples/. It is not a
particularly CPU or memory-intensive test, but due to the framework
creating and recreating the Nova environment over and over, typical
runtimes of the nova/tests/integrated/test_api_samples.py tests can take
more than 5 minutes.

This patch adds a new functional test suite for running these kinds of
tests. It sets up a single Nova environment, loads a database and
fixtures, runs the tests, and then tears down the Nova environment.

This patch just adds tests for flavors and versions, in order to keep
the patch size manageable. The tests themselves have not actually
changed, and the new base test class for the functional tests shares 90%
of the code in the existing nova/tests/integrated/api_sample_test_base
file except the Nova environment is not created and recreated in setUp()
and tearDown() each time a test method is run.

The result is that the tests run in a fraction of the time that the
existing integrated tests run.

Change-Id: Ic5d186e33a3f423a38beb64b485eb7f6467ced29

commit_message:
Changed template naming in fuel_agent

Made it using get_or_select_template instead of
get_template from jinja2. It allows to try several
different template names before template loader fails.
The motivation behind is that now we can have
some_ubuntu_1204_x86_64.jinja2
some_ubuntu.jinja2
some.jinja2
templates in order to make profile scheme more flexible.

Change-Id: I504cbeb1670966690887e02201286a3dff952284

commit_message:
Changed image data format in fuel_agent

Made it explicit and clear. User may define as many file
system images as he/she needs. Every image is to have
its own uri, format, container and other metadata. Currently,
it is possible to mix different image formats. For example,
image for a root file system might be an ext4 fs image
while /var image - TAR archive.

Change-Id: Ib957ff62e3613fed1e2826f322a056be7803fa48

commit_message:
Update Endpoint Filter API

A small subset of the Endpoint Filter APIs which pass in project_id
in the URL need to be updated to ensure the filter extension name i.e.
OS-EP-FILTER appear after the string /project/{project_id}.

Change-Id: If1688a4c919ee66e748e87815b72354d2059b399
Closes-Bug: #1362245

commit_message:
Update Endpoint Filter API

A small subset of the Endpoint Filter APIs which pass in project_id
in the URL need to be updated to ensure the filter extension name i.e.
OS-EP-FILTER appears after the string /project/{project_id}.

Furthermore, we need to maintain the original APIs that were defined
in the Icehouse release. See routers.py for more details.

Change-Id: Ic397b0d3a4ac56f7302e19bad3bd851852312858
Closes-Bug: 1362245

subject: Fix using key for ssh
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-09-22 09:38:00.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/test_utils.py', 'manila/utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix using key for ssh

Before this fix manila used only password or private key from default
.ssh directory. In this patch, calling the create function will use
one of this methods for authentication. Authentication is attempted
in the following order of priority:
* The private key;
* Any key we can find through an SSH agent;
* Any "id_rsa" or "id_dsa" key discoverable in ~/.ssh/;
* Plain username/password auth.

Change-Id: I74e00dabe5b5a93fb4fbbdcfef4969971af6d0a7
Closes-Bug: #1369913
'}]
commit_message:
Fix using key for ssh

Before this fix manila used only password or private key from default
.ssh directory. In this patch, calling the create function will use
one of this methods for authentication. Authentication is attempted
in the following order of priority:
* The private key;
* Any key we can find through an SSH agent;
* Any "id_rsa" or "id_dsa" key discoverable in ~/.ssh/;
* Plain username/password auth.

Change-Id: I74e00dabe5b5a93fb4fbbdcfef4969971af6d0a7
Closes-Bug: #1369913

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-09-22 14:43:54.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_neutron-compute-node.xml', 'doc/install-guide/section_neutron-ml2-compute-node.xml', 'doc/install-guide/section_neutron-ml2-controller-node.xml', 'doc/install-guide/section_neutron-controller-node.xml', 'doc/install-guide/section_neutron-network-node.xml', 'doc/install-guide/section_neutron-initial-networks.xml', 'doc/install-guide/ch_networking.xml', 'doc/install-guide/section_neutron-ml2-network-node.xml', 'doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml'], 'message': "Update neutron content for Juno

I updated neutron content in the installation guide for Juno
as follows:

1) Renamed files and IDs since the guide no longer needs to
   differentiate between the ML2 and OVS plug-ins.
2) Removed prompts specific to MySQL because most distributions
   will use MariaDB.
3) Explicitly created endpoint with 'regionOne' region to avoid
   inconsistent defaults.
4) Replaced 'auth_*' options with 'identity_uri' option.
5) Moved neutron configuration options to [neutron] section in
   nova.conf.
6) Recommended enabling verbose logging.
7) Removed workarounds for Ubuntu 12.04.
8) Removed note about CirrOS lacking support for the DHCP MTU
   option.
9) Explicitly defined flat external network type.
10) Added example command output and updated existing command
    output.
11) Added and updated glossary terms.
12) Implemented changes from the improvements blueprint including
    structure and phrasing.

Change-Id: I13baa94585bb6e8b22d8d79043fc84cbc2514954
Implements: blueprint installation-guide-improvements
"}]
commit_message:
Update neutron content for Juno

I updated neutron content in the installation guide for Juno
as follows:

1) Renamed files and IDs since the guide no longer needs to
   differentiate between the ML2 and OVS plug-ins.
2) Removed prompts specific to MySQL because most distributions
   will use MariaDB.
3) Explicitly created endpoint with 'regionOne' region to avoid
   inconsistent defaults.
4) Replaced 'auth_*' options with 'identity_uri' option.
5) Moved neutron configuration options to [neutron] section in
   nova.conf.
6) Recommended enabling verbose logging.
7) Removed workarounds for Ubuntu 12.04.
8) Removed note about CirrOS lacking support for the DHCP MTU
   option.
9) Explicitly defined flat external network type.
10) Added example command output and updated existing command
    output.
11) Added and updated glossary terms.
12) Implemented changes from the improvements blueprint including
    structure and phrasing.

Change-Id: I13baa94585bb6e8b22d8d79043fc84cbc2514954
Implements: blueprint installation-guide-improvements

commit_message:
Split autoscaling.py into separate files.

This patch further splits the autoscaling.py into three individual
modules each of which dedicated to one resource type.  The resulted
files are put into different sub-directories for better namespace
isolation.

Change-Id: Icf9d0e072ae490de558adf62e021042698cb18d0
Implements: partial-blueprint reorg-asg-code

commit_message:
Set horizon local_settings before compress

Compress fails because local_settings.py default
value is false. The settings file needs to be
created first.

Change-Id: I142a4d78880c143a13d5e715428a5c0937f33c9a
Closes-Bug: #1364938
blueprint fuel-deploy-juno

subject: Do not pip_install DIB for use with Ironic
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-19 17:53:33.000000000', 'files': ['lib/ironic'], 'message': 'Do not pip_install DIB for use with Ironic

pip_install'ing diskimage_builder to use with Ironic is not necessary
any longer, since it is now installed "as a service". Instead, rely on the
preparation devstack will have done by checking for the necessary
executable's availability.

Change-Id: I8ace493299a4b14a000151701da65d7cb05c7cee
'}]
commit_message:
Do not pip_install DIB for use with Ironic

pip_install'ing diskimage_builder to use with Ironic is not necessary
any longer, since it is now installed "as a service". Instead, rely on the
preparation devstack will have done by checking for the necessary
executable's availability.

Change-Id: I8ace493299a4b14a000151701da65d7cb05c7cee

commit_message:
Revert "libvirt: reworks configdrive creation"

This reverts commit 228d0221763b12f11ecbacde4db38b1151f96e31.

This commit introduced bug 1369627 (a security vulnerability), as
well as misunderstanding how our image caching works for libvirt.
I think we can achieve the same thing in a much simpler manner.

Change-Id: I7ede9b0f77710869197d9b48c6dd6bbc3087738c

commit_message:
FIX: Fail to remove the logical volume

The logical volume can not be removed when delete VM error. I look at the
code, found that parameter is a list in the libvirt's lvm, but in
imagebackend, parameters passed is a string.

Change-Id: I222f6c5cfe5be63105f2fd8afd7ccd209ca2e5f7
Closes-Bug: #1358552

commit_message:
libvirt: Unnecessary instance.save(s) called

When spawning an instance there may a considerable amount of
instance.save() called. This is not necessary as the compute
manager will update the instance after the spawn method has
successfully completed.

Change-Id: I61610b3869caeb7822eab3f2d09335744b75db28
Closes-bug: #1366548

subject: Update documentation for using keystone auth
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 330, 'name': 'John Dickinson', 'email': 'me@not.mn', 'username': 'notmyname'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 6968, 'name': 'Christian Schwede', 'email': 'cschwede@redhat.com', 'username': 'cschwede'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-09-15 12:19:02.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/keystoneauth.py', 'doc/source/overview_auth.rst'], 'message': 'Update documentation for using keystone auth

Cleanup and add clarification to the documentation
for using Keystone auth.

Update to refer to auth_token middleware being
distributed as part of the keystomemiddelware project
rather than keystone.

Include capabilities (/info) in the list of reasons
why delay_auth_decision might need to be set in
auth_token middleware config.

Add description of the project_id:user_id format
for container ACLs and emphasize that ids rather than
names should be used since this patch has now merged:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/86430

DocImpact
blueprint keystone-v3-support
Change-Id: Idda4a3dcf8240474f1d2d163016ca2d40ec2d589
'}]
commit_message:
Update documentation for using keystone auth

Cleanup and add clarification to the documentation
for using Keystone auth.

Update to refer to auth_token middleware being
distributed as part of the keystomemiddelware project
rather than keystone.

Include capabilities (/info) in the list of reasons
why delay_auth_decision might need to be set in
auth_token middleware config.

Add description of the project_id:user_id format
for container ACLs and emphasize that ids rather than
names should be used since this patch has now merged:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/86430

DocImpact
blueprint keystone-v3-support
Change-Id: Idda4a3dcf8240474f1d2d163016ca2d40ec2d589

commit_message:
Add "--no-overlap" option to swift-dispersion populate

This change allows the user to use a "--no-overlap" parameter when
running the tool multiple times. It will increase the coverage by
whatever is specified in the dispersion_coverage field of the conf
file in a manner where existing container/objects are left in place
and no partition is populated more than once.

Related-Bug: #1233045

Change-Id: I139fed2f4c967ba18d073b7ecd1e946ed4da1271

commit_message:
Live migrate each instance from one host to other hosts

Using the existing server live_migrate api, this new feature,
adds the ability for admins to live-migrate all running instances
from one host to other hosts. The patch implements the feature
for Nova API V2 and API V3.

Co-Authored-By: Cédric Soulas <cedric.soulas@cloudwatt.com>

Change-Id: Ie8dd1b66fb8eaefa6ff38752b1e4f46bab145820
Implements: blueprint host-servers-live-migrate

subject: Enable automatic failover of l3 routers
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-12 14:41:07.000000000', 'files': ['elements/neutron/os-apply-config/etc/neutron/neutron.conf', 'elements/neutron-network-node/element-deps', 'elements/neutron-network-node/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/80-neutron-networking'], 'message': "Enable automatic failover of l3 routers

When l3-agent is not working on a node, neutron server will
automatically move its routers to another l3-agent. Neutron server
detects l3-agent outage after 1-2 minutes, neutron-l3-agent is now
monitored every 30s by pacemaker which will restart the service in case of
a failure (this should cover most of outages). If outage is longer
(e.g. networking issue) and routers are reassigned to another node,
l3-agent will clean up routers from local node when it restarts (or when
it can communicate with neutron server again).

This solution is not perfect and doesn't cover some edge situations
described here: https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1174591
But I think this still improves current state of l3-agent HA.

This should not be needed once neutron l3 agent HA patch is merged
(I83f2a5d2af42164c42773b385ba7b00872eed54e).

Change-Id: Ifd8d73b3b1a5b13095e87683449aa4cab7579d3e
"}]
commit_message:
Enable automatic failover of l3 routers

When l3-agent is not working on a node, neutron server will
automatically move its routers to another l3-agent. Neutron server
detects l3-agent outage after 1-2 minutes, neutron-l3-agent is now
monitored every 30s by pacemaker which will restart the service in case of
a failure (this should cover most of outages). If outage is longer
(e.g. networking issue) and routers are reassigned to another node,
l3-agent will clean up routers from local node when it restarts (or when
it can communicate with neutron server again).

This solution is not perfect and doesn't cover some edge situations
described here: https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1174591
But I think this still improves current state of l3-agent HA.

This should not be needed once neutron l3 agent HA patch is merged
(I83f2a5d2af42164c42773b385ba7b00872eed54e).

Change-Id: Ifd8d73b3b1a5b13095e87683449aa4cab7579d3e

commit_message:
Fix issues with timeout and if a domain exists

* When creating a domain it would fail if the domain exists. New behaviour is
  to update the existing domain.
* Raise default request timeouts to 10

Change-Id: I4896f046feb1cc3382a4a848cb0d0689bed44b5b

commit_message:
Fix stack update for Python API

Change I30a2b223d7dd19a717ed989b419b1e6cb2ac143b
introduced 'existing' keyword to stack-udpate command that became effectively
required argument to stack.update method of the client's Python API,
breaking backward compatibility.

Change-Id: Icda3313805c29ab36773a4edc8c9f8c874b71ca3
Closes-Bug: #1371167

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8053, 'name': 'Nikolay Markov', 'email': 'nmarkov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'NikolayMarkov'}, {'_account_id': 8392, 'name': 'Aleksey Kasatkin', 'email': 'akasatkin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aleksey'}, {'_account_id': 8789, 'name': 'Dmitry Pyzhov', 'email': 'dpyzhov+gerrit@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dpyzhov'}, {'_account_id': 8882, 'name': 'Nastya Urlapova', 'email': 'aurlapova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'NastyaUrlapova'}, {'_account_id': 8965, 'name': 'Igor Shishkin', 'email': 'me@teran.ru', 'username': 'ishishkin'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9977, 'name': 'Aleksandra Fedorova', 'email': 'lp@bookwar.info', 'username': 'afedorova'}, {'_account_id': 11110, 'name': 'Alexander Charykov', 'email': 'monester@gmail.com', 'username': 'acharykov'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-09 09:53:10.000000000', 'files': ['utils/jenkins/artifact_helper.py'], 'message': 'Add helper script for artifacts naming schema.

Naming schema used in our Jenkins setup currently is not specified
anywhere in our docs. Let us define it in the following way::

 Token              Regexp
 fuel               "fuel"
 [-<ci_id>]         "(-(?P<ci_id>(gerrit)|(community)))?"
 [-<version>]       "(-(?P<version>(\d\.\d)|(master)))?"
 [-<art_type>]      "(-(?P<art_type>(upgrade)|(patching)))?"
 [-<build_number>]  "(-(?P<build_number>\d*))?"
 [-<timestamp>]     "(-(?P<timestamp>\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2}_\d{2}-\d{2}-\d{2}))?"
 .<art_ext>         "(\.(?P<art_ext>[a-z\.]*))\Z"

Helper script can be used to:

* enforce naming policy for future setups and across all Jenkins
  instances via 'test' subcommand (specification by implementation),
* provide data for internal shell scripts with 'parse --fmt <smth>'
  subcommand,
* track all the naming policy changes via usual Git/Gerrit workflow.

Change-Id: Ieb96cd15803f014f85f69b97e14f4c2d69be01fa
'}]
commit_message:
Add helper script for artifacts naming schema.

Naming schema used in our Jenkins setup currently is not specified
anywhere in our docs. Let us define it in the following way::

 Token              Regexp
 fuel               "fuel"
 [-<ci_id>]         "(-(?P<ci_id>(gerrit)|(community)))?"
 [-<version>]       "(-(?P<version>(\d\.\d)|(master)))?"
 [-<art_type>]      "(-(?P<art_type>(upgrade)|(patching)))?"
 [-<build_number>]  "(-(?P<build_number>\d*))?"
 [-<timestamp>]     "(-(?P<timestamp>\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2}_\d{2}-\d{2}-\d{2}))?"
 .<art_ext>         "(\.(?P<art_ext>[a-z\.]*))\Z"

Helper script can be used to:

* enforce naming policy for future setups and across all Jenkins
  instances via 'test' subcommand (specification by implementation),
* provide data for internal shell scripts with 'parse --fmt <smth>'
  subcommand,
* track all the naming policy changes via usual Git/Gerrit workflow.

Change-Id: Ieb96cd15803f014f85f69b97e14f4c2d69be01fa

subject: labs: wait for namespaces and interfaces
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-19 13:08:23.000000000', 'files': ['labs/scripts/setup_neutron_network.sh'], 'message': 'labs: wait for namespaces and interfaces

When setting up neutron router and DHCP, the time until namespaces and
interfaces are ready varies a lot (from less than a second to five
seconds and more), even on the same host system. If it takes longer, we
proceed too early which leaves the cluster misconfigured. In that case,
nova instances fail to get a DHCP address.

This patch makes sure the script waits until the interfaces are ready.

Change-Id: I346a098062d984956cf496e89f9ada2a38df0569
'}]
commit_message:
labs: wait for namespaces and interfaces

When setting up neutron router and DHCP, the time until namespaces and
interfaces are ready varies a lot (from less than a second to five
seconds and more), even on the same host system. If it takes longer, we
proceed too early which leaves the cluster misconfigured. In that case,
nova instances fail to get a DHCP address.

This patch makes sure the script waits until the interfaces are ready.

Change-Id: I346a098062d984956cf496e89f9ada2a38df0569

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-16 11:17:12.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_db_plugin.py', 'neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py'], 'message': "Non-EUI64 fixed IPs should be rejected for IPv6 SLAAC

When a port is created on a subnet that is configured for IPv6 SLAAC,
that port's IP address will be automatically generated (to a
pre-determined value, based on the subnet's IPv6 prefix and the port's
MAC address) using the EUI64 address algorithm. Therefore, any port
create request that includes a fixed IPv6 address that does not match
the expected IPv6 EUI64 address should be rejected.

This change adds a check for any fixed IP addresses that do not match
the expected automatically-generated addresses for port creation on
an IPv6 SLAAC subnet.

This change also removes a check for duplicate address assignment on
IPv6 SLAAC subnets. Duplicate address assignments on IPv6 SLAAC should
be prevented by the following:
- IPv6 prefixes are confirmed to be unique when the subnet is created.
- MAC addresses are confirmed to be unique when a port is created.
- This new change will only allow unique EUI64 addresses (based on
  unique prefix and unique MAC address) to get assigned to a port
  on an IPv6 SLAAC subnet.
(I tried leaving in the existing check for duplicate addresses on
IPv6 SLAAC subnets, but was at a loss as to how to modify the existing
associated unit test to force duplicate addresses, because of the
considerations listed above.)

Change-Id: I986abbad89fe003bbd34804b5143791865607494
Closes-Bug: #1369767
"}]
commit_message:
Non-EUI64 fixed IPs should be rejected for IPv6 SLAAC

When a port is created on a subnet that is configured for IPv6 SLAAC,
that port's IP address will be automatically generated (to a
pre-determined value, based on the subnet's IPv6 prefix and the port's
MAC address) using the EUI64 address algorithm. Therefore, any port
create request that includes a fixed IPv6 address that does not match
the expected IPv6 EUI64 address should be rejected.

This change adds a check for any fixed IP addresses that do not match
the expected automatically-generated addresses for port creation on
an IPv6 SLAAC subnet.

This change also removes a check for duplicate address assignment on
IPv6 SLAAC subnets. Duplicate address assignments on IPv6 SLAAC should
be prevented by the following:
- IPv6 prefixes are confirmed to be unique when the subnet is created.
- MAC addresses are confirmed to be unique when a port is created.
- This new change will only allow unique EUI64 addresses (based on
  unique prefix and unique MAC address) to get assigned to a port
  on an IPv6 SLAAC subnet.
(I tried leaving in the existing check for duplicate addresses on
IPv6 SLAAC subnets, but was at a loss as to how to modify the existing
associated unit test to force duplicate addresses, because of the
considerations listed above.)

Change-Id: I986abbad89fe003bbd34804b5143791865607494
Closes-Bug: #1369767

commit_message:
Do not cache auth token in Neutron DHCP provider

Currently token expire after some time and deploy breaks.
Also refactored all tests for Neutron DHCP provider, as
many of them were just broken (e.g. using non-existing asserts).

Change-Id: I38a8e95a09fd4737682e37b1162eb445fbc8012f
Closes-Bug: #1371503

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-06-02 12:05:14.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/network/test_manager.py', 'nova/network/floating_ips.py'], 'message': "Fixes 'Same hostname for different instances' bug

Classes that inherit from NetworkManager use the attribute instance_dns_manager
to handle DNS service operations. This attribute is an instance of the class
defined at CONF.instance_dns_manager, that is, by default,
'nova.network.noop_dns_driver.NoopDNSDriver'. Changing the default driver to
'nova.network.minidns.MiniDNS' implies in verifying if a DNS entry name is
unique into the domain before adding the new DNS entry.

DocImpact Any documentation considering NoopDNSDriver as default DNS driver have
to be updated.
UpgradeImpact Existing OpenStack setups in whose there are existing different
instances with the same hostname may be affected when introducing this patch.
Existing instances may be affected by any operation that need to reconfigure
networking on the instance, such as re-sizing or migrating.

Closes-Bug: #1283538

Change-Id: I2fdd8296431b3011b408759ccc63ba136e2f2b16
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes 'Same hostname for different instances' bug

Classes that inherit from NetworkManager use the attribute instance_dns_manager
to handle DNS service operations. This attribute is an instance of the class
defined at CONF.instance_dns_manager, that is, by default,
'nova.network.noop_dns_driver.NoopDNSDriver'. Changing the default driver to
'nova.network.minidns.MiniDNS' implies in verifying if a DNS entry name is
unique into the domain before adding the new DNS entry.

DocImpact Any documentation considering NoopDNSDriver as default DNS driver have
to be updated.
UpgradeImpact Existing OpenStack setups in whose there are existing different
instances with the same hostname may be affected when introducing this patch.
Existing instances may be affected by any operation that need to reconfigure
networking on the instance, such as re-sizing or migrating.

Closes-Bug: #1283538

Change-Id: I2fdd8296431b3011b408759ccc63ba136e2f2b16

commit_message:
Fix test not passing due to Nova patch

The test test_create_with_existing_server_name at
tempest/api/compute/servers/test_servers.py is not passing due to
the patch for the bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1283538.
This patch prevents the creation of different instances with the
same hostname into the same domain.
For further information, look at the Nova patch review at
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/94252/

Change-Id: I2278a5326c64633dc7afe043c1fc87abb8801f33

subject: labs: set lower MTU for bridge to instance VM
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-21 18:26:40.000000000', 'files': ['labs/scripts/setup_neutron_network.sh'], 'message': 'labs: set lower MTU for bridge to instance VM

The MTU on the bridge to the instance VMs needs to be lower than 1500 to
compensate for the GRE overhead. With an MTU of 1500, one thing that
fails is ssh authentication (into the instance VM).

This patch does not help for the CirrOS 0.3.2 image which we currently
use, because it is not able to pick up MTU values via DHCP.

Change-Id: I2a04b62beef6120e811f00472aa7395ab3d683dc
Co-Authored-By: Pranav Salunke <dguitarbite@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
labs: set lower MTU for bridge to instance VM

The MTU on the bridge to the instance VMs needs to be lower than 1500 to
compensate for the GRE overhead. With an MTU of 1500, one thing that
fails is ssh authentication (into the instance VM).

This patch does not help for the CirrOS 0.3.2 image which we currently
use, because it is not able to pick up MTU values via DHCP.

Change-Id: I2a04b62beef6120e811f00472aa7395ab3d683dc
Co-Authored-By: Pranav Salunke <dguitarbite@gmail.com>

subject: Stop using intersphinx
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-13 07:20:51.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py'], 'message': "Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910
"}]
commit_message:
Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910

commit_message:
labs: fix shared folder restore after export

Fix the code responsible for reattaching shared directories after VMs
have been exported.

For OVA export:
- use saved share names instead of default name (for the sake of
  correctness; it is unlikely that a user will change the name)

For dir export:
- save and reattach shared directories after export

Change-Id: I79162c1ec788aa1d89104aa92aebeae2bb05adf5

We are going to be removing the RPC tests shortly, and the versions in

remove all of the RPC code entirely.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-11 02:09:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/integrated/api_samples_test_base.py'], 'message': 'Fixes AttributeError with api sample test fail

Avoid AttributeError which could be raised with api sample tests
when a string is expected but a non string type is returned
instead. This makes debugging api sample test failures easier as
the expected and actual values are displayed in the error message
rather than an AttributeError exception.

Change-Id: I4d124e4d80779c4431926619f0ca876a513a8462
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes AttributeError with api sample test fail

Avoid AttributeError which could be raised with api sample tests
when a string is expected but a non string type is returned
instead. This makes debugging api sample test failures easier as
the expected and actual values are displayed in the error message
rather than an AttributeError exception.

Change-Id: I4d124e4d80779c4431926619f0ca876a513a8462

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-16 10:56:35.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/cisco/cfg_agent/device_drivers/driver_mgr.py'], 'message': 'Access correct key for template name

When an exception occurs while loading the config agent driver, the
handler tries to log a message, but accesses the wrong key to get the
template name. This causes another exception, which masks the original
exception.

This change accesses the correct key and performs logging inside a
with block to (defensively) preserve the exception context.

Change-Id: I3991bc4c509bbd8d68f7a1c8c8314404f2e0eafa
Closes-Bug: #1368900
'}]
commit_message:
Access correct key for template name

When an exception occurs while loading the config agent driver, the
handler tries to log a message, but accesses the wrong key to get the
template name. This causes another exception, which masks the original
exception.

This change accesses the correct key and performs logging inside a
with block to (defensively) preserve the exception context.

Change-Id: I3991bc4c509bbd8d68f7a1c8c8314404f2e0eafa
Closes-Bug: #1368900

commit_message:
Fix wrong inheritance for class HeatBaseTest

Sometimes the Sahara Platform test fails without any messages.
This bug occurs when we run Heat and Sahara Platform tests together.
If we run the Sahara test only, everything will be OK. The problem is
in wrong inheritance for class HeatBaseTest in heatmanager.py.

Change-Id: I88c4100d3603cffc4f353386490802fc6f6953b7
Closes-Bug: #1367743

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-19 23:05:41.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/utils.py'], 'message': 'add_node_capability and rm_node_capability unable to save changes to db

Changes to elements in existing node.properties dictionary will not get
saved to database by node.save(context) method. The properties dictionary
needs to be replaced by a new one to get the changes to be saved in the db.

Change-Id: I3bb65d00e141aedcb1278c1a700d12c9b29f7232
Closes-bug:#1371816
'}]
commit_message:
add_node_capability and rm_node_capability unable to save changes to db

Changes to elements in existing node.properties dictionary will not get
saved to database by node.save(context) method. The properties dictionary
needs to be replaced by a new one to get the changes to be saved in the db.

Change-Id: I3bb65d00e141aedcb1278c1a700d12c9b29f7232
Closes-bug:#1371816

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-07-08 09:15:45.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_extension_security_group.py', 'neutron/extensions/securitygroup.py'], 'message': "Don't convert numeric protocol values to int

They are treated as strings everywhere. Converting them to int causes problems
when using postgresql as the database backend because it doesn't automatically
cast them back to integer.

Change-Id: I9f0a5149d24a4c003409728e50376569c97e7325
Closes-bug: 1330490
(cherry picked from commit 3be62f878e8165cf3bce357a00b8a583773f7d3b)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't convert numeric protocol values to int

They are treated as strings everywhere. Converting them to int causes problems
when using postgresql as the database backend because it doesn't automatically
cast them back to integer.

Change-Id: I9f0a5149d24a4c003409728e50376569c97e7325
Closes-bug: 1330490
(cherry picked from commit 3be62f878e8165cf3bce357a00b8a583773f7d3b)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-20 11:39:21.000000000', 'files': ['lib/cinder'], 'message': 'Check if cinder services are enabled before starting them

In a multi-node setup it is not possible to only use c-vol because
it will be tried to also start c-api, c-sch and c-bak, which will
fail.

Change-Id: Ide64d3c6b8580ce5f62ff5f17b47f37f72e9aa44
'}]
commit_message:
Check if cinder services are enabled before starting them

In a multi-node setup it is not possible to only use c-vol because
it will be tried to also start c-api, c-sch and c-bak, which will
fail.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-31 15:25:25.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/test_hp3par.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/san/hp/hp_3par_common.py'], 'message': 'Fixed nova VM live migration issue with 3PAR

Nova bypasses the cinder checks for a volume

commit_message:
Fixed nova VM live migration issue with 3PAR

Nova bypasses the cinder checks for a volume
being available, when it tries to attach a volume
to a new host during live migration.  The assumption
in cinder to this point has been that volumes can only
be attached to one host.  The 3PAR driver worked under
that assumption.  This assumption fell apart during detach
time as the driver was only looking for a VLUN on the
entire 3PAR, since it assumed it could only exist on one host.

This patch ensures that the driver looks for the VLUN on the
hostname it expects.

Closes-Bug: 1288927
(cherry picked from commit 2c1701e2f50feb5fa25ea6fb1b620f39346779de)
Cherry-pick: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/78736/11

Change-Id: I9f0044f8f1965624f1683045e18d8e4df1ce2272

Sometimes a vm gets its tap interface unset and reset too fast to be caught in

interface will be reconfigured.

Since the TAG ID is only available via the "Port" table (in the 'tag' column),

commit_message:
Fixing lost vlan ids on interfaces

Sometimes a vm gets its tap interface unset and reset too fast to be caught in
an agent loop, and its vlan tag was not reset.

We now detect if an interface loses its vlan tag, and if it happens the
interface will be reconfigured.

Since the TAG ID is only available via the "Port" table (in the 'tag' column),
we couldn't reuse the get_vif_port_set() method's run_vsctl call which queries
the "Interface" table, and needed a specific run_vsct call to the "Port" table
in the new get_port_tag_dict() method.

Change-Id: I0bfd980019fed5754bd9e00c9d3fe2d909bf89d4
Closes-Bug: 1240849

commit_message:
Show all custom properties on image detail page

Display all custom properties of a given image on the Image Detail
page. Titles for the custom properties can optionally be displayed
if they are defined in IMAGE_CUSTOM_PROPERTY_TITLES in local
settings.

(cherry picked from commit def80bef83c579114e16a0eae139ce7c1a28cecb)

Conflicts:
	openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/images_and_snapshots/images/tabs.py

Change-Id: If97dd4a37c40d1edbc2264e298e70b14545f1dc2
Closes-Bug: #1249543

commit_message:
Don't detach root device volume

Detach a root device volume may cause various guest error. Although
we can argue that it's user response to not detach the root device
volume, a check in nova will be more helpful.

We can either give a warning message, or not allow it. This patch
forbids this operation, considering that even in real system, remove
root device does not make much sense.

Closes-Bug: #1279300

Signed-off-by: Yunhong Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>
(cherry picked from commit 7fbb42296970ee30d21bbd66b144a2ab421aa17f)

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_volumes.py
	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_extended_volumes.py

Change-Id: I01f086be668b35442a2f139f4d7dc96884a3bda6

commit_message:
Fix broken API os-migrations

The return is not what we are expecting:
  migration-list: 'unicode' object has no attribute 'iteritems'

The conversion of the object nova.objects.MigrationList into a list
is not applied automatically.

Closes-Bug: #1260249
(cherry picked from commit 4963fa0fa0d96d8641339614438d42c81958f728)

Conflicts:

	nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/migrations.py
	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_migrations.py
	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_migrations.py

	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_migrations.py

commit_message:
Delete iSCSI devices after volume detached

Previously, after detaching from a volume, the iSCSI device
remains attached on the compute node until all LUNs for a given
IQN are detached -- causing issues when LUNs are reused for
different volumes. This change will delete the device(s)
associated with the detached volume so LUNs can be reused.

Conflicts:

	nova/virt/libvirt/volume.py

Fixes bug 1112483
Change-Id: Icae3ec4d1ee2036fbba7b9eb5c03a1c86014fcc0
(cherry picked from commit 8a6ee4808782820cc0938519eb3db63a5eb9a2ff)

Recently it was observed that with large numbers of volumes
that things like "cinder list" could take extremely long to
return.

For example, running cinder list on a system with 1000 volumes took
greater than 30 seconds to return.  It turns out that the cause of
this is the addition of visible admin_metadata.

1. The original patch probably shouldn't have gone in

   complications and introduces confusion.
2. The REAL issue here is that since the standar gets are made

we expect to do display the visible admin_meta, we pass in a flag

metadata.  This way we can elevate the context if needed and avoid

commit_message:
Remove second get call to list/show volumes

Recently it was observed that with large numbers of volumes
that things like "cinder list" could take extremely long to
return.

For example, running cinder list on a system with 1000 volumes took
greater than 30 seconds to return.  It turns out that the cause of
this is the addition of visible admin_metadata.

There's two problems with this:
1. The original patch probably shouldn't have gone in
   data is either admin data or it's not, selectively picking
   pieces of admin data out to provide to the user just creates
   complications and introduces confusion.
2. The REAL issue here is that since the standar gets are made
   with the standard user context, the add_visible_admin_metadata
   would go through and do an elevated context get on every single
   volume individually.  This is what caused the horrible performance
   issue on cinder list with large numbers of volumes.

Running as admin, or removing the second call drops this down to about 3
seconds for the same 1000 volume list.

This patch removes the secondary admin context get_call.  Instead where
we expect to do display the visible admin_meta, we pass in a flag
requesting that the volume object we're getting has the appropriate
metadata.  This way we can elevate the context if needed and avoid
iterating through the gets again.

This patch also cleans up the get_visible_admin_meta methods, and
consolidates both V1 and V2 to use the utils method.

Closes-Bug: 1317606

Conflicts:
	cinder/api/contrib/volume_manage.py
	cinder/api/v1/volumes.py
	cinder/api/v2/volumes.py
	cinder/tests/api/v1/test_volumes.py
	cinder/tests/api/v2/stubs.py
	cinder/tests/api/v2/test_volumes.py
	cinder/volume/api.py

Change-Id: I3fb7aefb7d8a5664b0a3fb3958f509b5cd621320
(cherry picked from commit 0505bb268942534ad5d6ecd5e34a4d9b0e7f5c04)

commit_message:
Fix glance api v2 create empty image scenario

Currently, when user call glance api v2 to create an empty image,
then the image.size pollster will get an image with size=None, and
that sampe will be stored in database, then when we call
v2/samples/image.size, the wsme.exc.MissingArgument will be raised.

We should check the image.size when yield samples.

Change-Id: I4e5124cdac03eda0154d437777b17349985f067d
Closes-Bug: #1304678

commit_message:
Make sure that gateway is in CIDR range by default

Git commit c3706fa2 introduced the force_gateway_on_subnet
option that verified that the defined gateway is in the CIDR
range of a newly created or updated subnet. However, the default
value was False for backwards compatability reasons. The default
will change to True and the option will be marked as deprecated.

For IPv6, the gateway must be in the CIDR only if the gateway
is not a link local address.

Conflicts:
        neutron/common/config.py
        neutron/tests/unit/ml2/test_ml2_plugin.py
        neutron/tests/unit/nuage/test_nuage_plugin.py
        neutron/tests/unit/oneconvergence/test_nvsd_plugin.py
        neutron/tests/unit/test_db_plugin.py

DocImpact
Change-Id: I04fd1caec6da5dceee3f736b3f91f2468150ba2a
Closes-Bug: #1304181
(cherry picked from commit 0e44b7b5418c400af7358a5391f350f2f737929e)

commit_message:
Fix parameter checking about quota update api

In quota_classes and quotas update API, parameters are checked
whether they are integer or not.
But when pass float values to these APIs, error doesn't occur.
Float values should be forbidden for the following reasons.
(1)If the value that user submitted and the value registered
   actually are different, user will be confused.
(2)Error messages of these APIs are "...must be integer...".
(3)In horizon, if a float is submitted, error message is displayed.

This patch fixes this problem.

Closes-Bug: #1243037
(cherry picked from commit 01e1c027754b47239b9f9a6c40196512ec262986)

Conflicts:
	nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/quota_classes.py
	nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/quota_classes.py
	nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/quota_sets.py
	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_quota_classes.py
	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_quota_sets.py

Change-Id: I4c7df52ffff2d997da4e6267e25ec2ea4ab6f153

commit_message:
Add Bigswitch plugin in migration that creates 'agents' table

For creating table 'networkdhcpagentbindings' table 'agents' is
needed to exist, but Bigswitch plugin was not added to the
migration_for_plugins list in migration 511471cc46b_agent_ext_model_supp.

Closes-Bug: #1337216

commit_message:
Fix service API and cells

The move to the object model broke the service API when used together
with cells. The underlying problem is how cells will overload the id
field with a cell path to uniquely identify each service in each cell.

Changing the id to a string would defeat the purpose of the object model
so this patch uses a proxy to modify the id on access to make the
difference transparent to the API.

Closes-bug: 1251043
(cherry picked from commit 0df94733f7283cbc1e9ae7d27f5cd443158cae8e)

Conflicts:

	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_services.py
	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_services.py

Change-Id: I165b5d64b0c1556511eb02d179ca9fc6f101c008

commit_message:
fix memory leak for _safe_log

In _safe_log it use recursive closure. The gc can not free stack for
those recursive closure for cycle-reference. So cut down the cycle
to fix it.

Change-Id: I3bd48e16fb2efd23674b7346168ad1a147019b89

commit_message:
Add host_routes property to Neutron subnet resource

Template snippet that was functionally tested:

subnet:
  Type: OS::Neutron::Subnet
  Properties:
    host_routes:
    - {destination: 192.168.1.0/24, nexthop: 192.168.1.2}
    network_id: {Ref: network}
    ip_version: 4
    cidr: 10.0.3.0/24
    allocation_pools:
    - {end: 10.0.3.150, start: 10.0.3.20}

(Next hop probably would make more sense to be in the CIDR)

Change-Id: I36f72f006a1ba48a6ed55a1c361b3df8d1359caa
Closes-Bug: #1250710
Co-Authored-By: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-27 18:42:49.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/security_group.py', 'heat/tests/test_security_group.py'], 'message': 'Fail if non-existent security group referenced

When using AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup resources with nova-network (not
Neutron), if a SourceSecurityGroupName was specified in a rule but the
name did not correspond to an extant security group it would be silently
ignored. This change ensures that any such error in the template will cause
creation of the security group to fail.

Closes-bug: #1291091
(cherry picked from commit 8ce9a177c47b3ee224200690d7181c784c418292)

Change-Id: I9344451c83f4184ef46d4e9906b94abda08836df
'}]
commit_message:
Fail if non-existent security group referenced

When using AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup resources with nova-network (not
Neutron), if a SourceSecurityGroupName was specified in a rule but the
name did not correspond to an extant security group it would be silently
ignored. This change ensures that any such error in the template will cause
creation of the security group to fail.

Closes-bug: #1291091
(cherry picked from commit 8ce9a177c47b3ee224200690d7181c784c418292)

Change-Id: I9344451c83f4184ef46d4e9906b94abda08836df

commit_message:
Segment LUN clones in NetApp iSCSI

The NetApp ZAPI for clone_create and clone_start has a maximum size.
This fix breaks the lun into consumable sizes for the ZAPI.

Closes-Bug: 1284182
Closes-Bug: 1296881
Closes-Bug: 1288962
Change-Id: Id4d0872c6099b7cfc73d806d772a3ae051a76b70
(cherry picked from commit af4a58d672cfa0c4b63015e7e783461570296c76)

commit_message:
Specify lld in tgt config backends

Otherwise when running tgt-admin --delete, it might forget
to invoke tgtadmn with "--lld iscsi" in order to delete the low-level
iscsi exports, which can cause crashes or hangs later on.

Closes-Bug: #1311640
Change-Id: I436c67c30565089236e987d84ac2609eedd2d2c7
(cherry picked from commit 872b7ca0fc5ce4911fdaadee464d46be5a38058d)

commit_message:
Don't expect nova-network is up if Neutron is used

If we use Neutron as network provider for OpenStack
cloud, nova-network service is not enabled on compute
nodes, so we should expect 14 Nova services are running
instead of 16.

Change-Id: Ie929d1c1f46dc11000c1b06469dafa5c8aaed330
Closes-bug: #1372056

If we use Neutron as network provider for OpenStack
cloud, nova-network service is not enabled on compute
nodes, so we should expect 14 Nova services are running
instead of 16.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-10 09:06:35.000000000', 'files': ['glance/db/sqlalchemy/metadata.py'], 'message': "Change open(file) to with block

Currently script which loads metadata definitions to database
uses open(file) to stream files. This isn't the best practice
because in case of any errors this code may not be safe.
To solve this problem this patch changes open(file) to
'with open(file) as...:' block. It allows us to ensure that every
resource is cleaned up when the code finishes running.

Change-Id: I4a85700061ed5050f4356f1b39ea128931626c83
Closes-Bug: #1367172
"}]
commit_message:
Change open(file) to with block

Currently script which loads metadata definitions to database
uses open(file) to stream files. This isn't the best practice
because in case of any errors this code may not be safe.
To solve this problem this patch changes open(file) to
'with open(file) as...:' block. It allows us to ensure that every
resource is cleaned up when the code finishes running.

Change-Id: I4a85700061ed5050f4356f1b39ea128931626c83
Closes-Bug: #1367172

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6094, 'name': 'Navneet Singh', 'email': 'navsinghnitd@gmail.com', 'username': 'singn'}, {'_account_id': 8124, 'name': 'cbrandily', 'email': 'zzelle@gmail.com', 'username': 'cbrandily'}, {'_account_id': 8157, 'name': 'Bertrand LALLAU', 'email': 'bertrand.lallau@gmail.com', 'username': 'blallau'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9366, 'name': 'Andrew Kerr', 'email': 'andrew.kerr@netapp.com', 'username': 'andrew-kerr'}, {'_account_id': 10622, 'name': 'SolidFire CI', 'email': 'openstack.ci@solidfire.com', 'username': 'sfci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-19 13:20:12.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/api.py'], 'message': 'Netapp: set HTTP Authorization header to avoid 401 response

NetApp drivers (cmode, 7mode, iseries) have to send requests twice
in order to perform an action.
The first request is always respond with "401 Unauthorized", the
second is the same with an "Authorization" header added.
This is due to urllib2 implementation.
This patch set the "Authorization" header at the first request.
Hence HTTP requests number is divided by 2.

Closes-Bug: #1370573

Change-Id: Ia49a49b5b65c92e4e7104960d36e84076213cc12
'}]
commit_message:
Netapp: set HTTP Authorization header to avoid 401 response

NetApp drivers (cmode, 7mode, iseries) have to send requests twice
in order to perform an action.
The first request is always respond with "401 Unauthorized", the
second is the same with an "Authorization" header added.
This is due to urllib2 implementation.
This patch set the "Authorization" header at the first request.
Hence HTTP requests number is divided by 2.

Closes-Bug: #1370573

Change-Id: Ia49a49b5b65c92e4e7104960d36e84076213cc12

commit_message:
Disable deploy some releases

In order to force customers moving to new releases or for technical
reasons we want to forbid deploying some releases. For this reason we
need to introduce a special field in the Relases model.

Please note, the field has no affect in experimental mode.

Change-Id: Iaf315d291ce9f18ad52b15c030be193d0d5ea6f9
Closes-Bug: #1368100

commit_message:
labs: update CirrOS image from 0.3.2 to 0.3.3

Update CirrOS image from 0.3.2 to 0.3.3. The reason for updating now is
that 0.3.3 allows setting the MTU via DHCP. Without that feature, users
would have to lower the MTU manually from the instance VM's VNC console.

Change-Id: Iee7530cb41e2a85af4a939fa004ac9e3546b6339

commit_message:
Replaces assertEqual with assertTrue and assertFalse

In order to improve coding practices and be aligned to a standard,
self.assertEqual(...,True) statements where replaced with
self.assertTrue and self.assertFalse.

Change-Id: I4150a343493beae03d6f71c88e84f60d14fb60e1
Closes-Bug: #1230127

subject: Stop using intersphinx
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-13 07:38:15.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py'], 'message': "Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910
"}]
commit_message:
Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910

This change, as an enhancement, allows generating separated sample

    etc/glance-api.conf.sample

commit_message:
Enabling separated sample config file generation

As a common approach most projects used now and Oslo preferred, this
change enabled sample configuration file generation mechanism for
each Glance services.

This change, as an enhancement, allows generating separated sample
configuration files for each Glance major services, e.g.:

    etc/glance-api.conf.sample
    etc/glance-cache.conf.sample
    etc/glance-manage.conf.sample
    etc/glance-registry.conf.sample
    etc/glance-scrubber.conf.sample

It is different than I94d486d6686815c45705a7a9b00fb26062e1eb63
which only supports generating an unified sample configuration
file to including all Glance available options.

This mechanism  not only can help auditing by packager, milestone
maintainer or developer as a function (testenv) of tox, but also
those separated configuration files could make deployment be easy.
And it helps keeping sample configuration files be update with
code change.

The change added "genconfigs" function as a tox testenv (-egenconfigs),
and it dependes on oslo-config-generator function of oslo.config.

The change doesn't introduce those sample files Glance repo, so
next step is to investigate if we can generate them in gate
automatically when a change was merged.

Related-Change-Id: I15686708fc9460948a58cfea3d18dae40ba1fda9
Related-Change-Id: Iae31856d5886ee78786972d80c7c103c3460a2b3
Related-Change-Id: I76043b08e2872867e5af2a5ac902e4d092fda5c8
Closes-Bug: #1300546
Closes-Bug: #1361963

Change-Id: Ibe03a3fe80b96ca32acb1a6bea7e38e6075951bb
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-09-18 01:32:12.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/messaging/_drivers/common.py'], 'message': 'fix memory leak for function _safe_log

In _safe_log it uses recursive closure. The gc can not free stack for
this recursive closure for cycle-reference. So cut down the cycle
to fix it.

Change-Id: I05fbd7091b886344d76b172a5ad66d9225599d69
'}]
commit_message:
fix memory leak for function _safe_log

In _safe_log it uses recursive closure. The gc can not free stack for
this recursive closure for cycle-reference. So cut down the cycle
to fix it.

Resolved-bug: #1365892
Change-Id: I05fbd7091b886344d76b172a5ad66d9225599d69

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-17 09:59:39.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_imagebackend.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: convert encrypted LVM test to avoid DB usage

The EncryptedLvmTestCase test case was depending on the DB setup
for no purpose. This masked a bug whereby the test was relying
on the implicit import of nova.keymgr.conf_key_mgr config opts.
Explicitly import the config opt and remove DB setup. This
improves performance from 1.8s to 0.6s

Partial-bug: #1369516
Change-Id: Icd5c27b3ac6cab5a014fae65904bbbefb5343282
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: convert encrypted LVM test to avoid DB usage

The EncryptedLvmTestCase test case was depending on the DB setup
for no purpose. This masked a bug whereby the test was relying
on the implicit import of nova.keymgr.conf_key_mgr config opts.
Explicitly import the config opt and remove DB setup. This
improves performance from 1.8s to 0.6s

Partial-bug: #1369516
Change-Id: Icd5c27b3ac6cab5a014fae65904bbbefb5343282

commit_message:
libvirt: convert test_dmcrypt to avoid DB usage

Nothing in the dmcrypt test case uses the DB, so it was
incurring the DB setup penalty for no gain. Switch to
use NoDBTestCase reducing time from 1.7s to 0.09s

Partial-bug: #1369516
Change-Id: Ifd4b919f60f48f691d83cedb6ce7ea18c98636ad

This adds some missing API test coverage for listing ports by

commit_message:
Add missing baremetal API tests

This adds some missing API test coverage for listing ports by
node id, node by instance uuid, node by chassis id, and listing
nodes by instance association status.  In addition to the required
client changes, this adds a common waiter for baremetal nodes which
can be leveraged in the future by the baremetal scenario tests.

Change-Id: I175da30516d697a2b3115353f405e0fe3e1ccc76

commit_message:
libvirt: convert test_blockinfo.py to avoid DB usage

Remove use of the flavour/instance DB access in the blockinfo
test case by using the Instance object instead. This speeds up
execution from approx 3 seconds to 0.3 seconds.

Partial-bug: #1369516
Change-Id: Ibb76ae64edf48012c3eddfe2eb656aa58bd198b1

commit_message:
Add list by user to shell

Adds "--user" as a search option to the list command.

Also since seach by tenant or user also needs all_tenants=1 add
this to the seach options automatically instead of making users
remember to add it

Change-Id: Icc828080b400aecdb320b721c569992677848cc6

subject: Use common code instead of novaclient.utils
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-19 14:15:48.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/base.py', 'novaclient/extension.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/shell.py', 'novaclient/utils.py', 'novaclient/v3/shell.py', 'novaclient/tests/test_utils.py', 'novaclient/client.py', 'novaclient/shell.py'], 'message': 'Use common code instead of novaclient.utils

Module `novaclient.utils` contains a lot of functions which are
presented in modules from common code.

* service_type -> novaclient.openstack.common.cliutils.service_type
* get_service_type -> novaclient.openstack.common.cliutils.get_service_type
* pretty_choice_list ->
      novaclient.openstack.common.cliutils.pretty_choice_list
* import_class -> oslo.utils.importutils.importclass
* HookableMixin -> novaclient.openstack.common.apiclient.base.HookableMixin

Change-Id: Ia6cac058da12c852d92f26875a66ae31cc4c63d4
'}]
commit_message:
Use common code instead of novaclient.utils

Module `novaclient.utils` contains a lot of functions which are
presented in modules from common code.

* service_type -> novaclient.openstack.common.cliutils.service_type
* get_service_type -> novaclient.openstack.common.cliutils.get_service_type
* pretty_choice_list ->
      novaclient.openstack.common.cliutils.pretty_choice_list
* import_class -> oslo.utils.importutils.importclass
* HookableMixin -> novaclient.openstack.common.apiclient.base.HookableMixin

Change-Id: Ia6cac058da12c852d92f26875a66ae31cc4c63d4

commit_message:
Add progress and cell_name into notifications

When the instance DB record is updated, we send notifications. To make
those more useful, I have added in cell_name and progress. These fields
where added after the initial notifications were added.

Change-Id: I3bc770e3b8f211c27e5e4aadd1819507d643cc75
Closes-Bug: #1366758

commit_message:
docs: Use linkcode instead of viewcode extension

Instead of viewcode extension that generates htmls from code
and links there we use linkcode extension that allows to add
links directly to git.openstack.org nicely highlighted sources.

Change-Id: I96fae99fb4a6b4204fff50ae09c8b0889ea2b76c

subject: (WIP) StateFlow pattern
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-06 16:34:32.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/patterns/state_flow.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/patterns/test_state_flow.py'], 'message': "(WIP) StateFlow pattern

Experiments for blueprint stateflow-pattern.

The pattern will be backed by DiGraph. Some interesting analysis will
be added to ensure all invariants are hold. Looks like we can't have
StateFlow in 'allways good' state -- sometimes you'll add transition
that break invariant, and then add another transition that puts
that puts everything back to good. We'll see how to express this in API.

As for engine side, the plan is to steal some ideas from
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/87417/, but do everything completely
different because I very much hope to come up with something simpler
for graph action and analyzer.

I'll be grateful if someone comes up with good more or less real-life
examples for the pattern, what I have now is too artificial.

Change-Id: I885d50dbcff1a0ae90ac8d5984400357293e016a
"}]
commit_message:
(WIP) StateFlow pattern

Experiments for blueprint stateflow-pattern.

The pattern will be backed by DiGraph. Some interesting analysis will
be added to ensure all invariants are hold. Looks like we can't have
StateFlow in 'allways good' state -- sometimes you'll add transition
that break invariant, and then add another transition that puts
that puts everything back to good. We'll see how to express this in API.

As for engine side, the plan is to steal some ideas from
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/87417/, but do everything completely
different because I very much hope to come up with something simpler
for graph action and analyzer.

I'll be grateful if someone comes up with good more or less real-life
examples for the pattern, what I have now is too artificial.

Change-Id: I885d50dbcff1a0ae90ac8d5984400357293e016a

There is no need for deployers to have requirements needed by a

Change-Id: I75161791e6d2145457222dd6ccb1bcbc40d44fa5

commit_message:
Remove specs respository from projects.txt

There is no need for deployers to have requirements needed by a
specs repository. As such, remove the need to sync the keystone-specs
repository with global-requirements.

Change-Id: I75161791e6d2145457222dd6ccb1bcbc40d44fa5

BSN: Allow concurrent reads to consistency DB

database lock the block was originally protecting against
is gone.

subject: Raise a runtime error when mixed green/non-green futures
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-09-06 23:53:23.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/utils/async_utils.py'], 'message': 'Raise a runtime error when mixed green/non-green futures

To avoid the dead-lock scenario when green futures are being
waited on in the same call as non-green futures just disallow
this rare and unlikely scenario in the first place.

Change-Id: I5b57f7aae94ae40d22047b0b085e4d99e034c2a6
'}]
commit_message:
Raise a runtime error when mixed green/non-green futures

To avoid the dead-lock scenario when green futures are being
waited on in the same call as non-green futures just disallow
this rare and unlikely scenario in the first place.

Change-Id: I5b57f7aae94ae40d22047b0b085e4d99e034c2a6
